The business being developed to fund the buy outs is the extraction of carrageenan from the seaweed farming activities that already exist.· Packaged real-life data sets from Operation Wallacea expeditions for use in the classroom in order to develop understanding of biodiversity science issues amongst young people around the world. This project, called the Wallace Resource Library, is now in use in over 500 schools around the world.It is only with the continued participation of students such as Daniel that we will be able to develop and advance our work. Daniel is being given a unique opportunity to take part in this experience of a lifetime whilst undertaking vital conservation work for Operation Wallacea and the local community and I can only ask once again that you would consider supporting such an important project. If you have any questions or queries about any aspect of Operation Wallacea and would like some additional information, please do not hesitate to contact us at the Operation Wallacea office or check out our website at www.opwall.com.Yours faithfullyPippa DisneyOperation Wallacea

story:
WE DID IT!!!! plus attained our stretch goal of $25,000!  THANK YOU!

Why the Campaign?

This campaign will help us raise $20,000 to help build 32 new non-motorized miles of the Continental Divide National Scenic Trail (CDT) in the Cochetopa Hills in Southern Colorado.  This project will engage youth from the Southwest Conservation Corps, Tony Boone Trails (a local trail Contractor), and volunteers from partner organizations and the Continental Divide Trail Coalition (CDTC).   The $20,000 will help us secure the funds to obtain the entire project cost ($200,000) and help us build it in just 2 years! But we need your help! The CDT is currently 75 % complete and this project will help us move 32 miles closer to 100%!

 

What is the Continental Divide National Scenic Trail? (CDT)

The dream of a 3,100 mile-long trail spanning the backbone of America from Mexico to Canada was realized when Congress designated the CDT in 1978.  Once complete, the CDT will connect countless communities along its spine across Montana, Idaho, Wyoming, Colorado and New Mexico traversing three national parks, one national monument, 25 national forests, and 5 BLM areas. Considered one of the greatest long-distance trails in the world, along with the Appalachian (A.T.) and Pacific Crest (PCT) Trails, they make up "Triple Crown" of National Scenic Trails. 

(Learn more about the CDT in this video)

Urgency to Support the CDT

Unlike the PCT and the A.T., the CDT is incomplete, despite being created 36 years ago.  The CDT is falling through the cracks, and is facing great difficulties in maintaining what so many have worked so hard to build and is threatened by ever shrinking federal budgets and resources.  Because the Trail is unfinished, it is vulnerable to interests incompatible with the vision of the Trail as a remote back-country primitive experience.  That's why we need to act now to get this segment of the Trail completed and protect this amazing landscape for everyone.  This section is one of the last two remaining road walks and unprotected areas along the CDT in Colorado. The US Forest Service and our partners are ready to move forward on the construction of this segment of the CDT as it has been on hold already for over 7 years. And, without your support, this project will be on hold for at least another two years. 

CDT Gap Map

Take a look at this map and all of the areas where the CDT remains unprotected and vulnerable and see where the Cochetopa Hills Gap area is located. Nearly 25% of the Trail still needs us to finish the job and we can't let this nationally significant experience falter under our watch.

What is the Opportunity?

The Trail belongs to the American Public and the CDTC has the responsibility to manage the Trail and its resources in a sacred trust so that it continues to nurture others the way it has nurtured us.  The US Forest Service 2009 CDT Comprehensive Plan states "the nature and purposes of the CDT are to provide for high-quality scenic, primitive hiking and horseback riding opportunities and to conserve natural, historic, and cultural resources along the CDT corridor."  When complete, this 32 mile trail section (which co-aligns with the Colorado Trail) will be a highly desirable, primitive back-country hiking and horseback riding experience. 

The Cochetopa Hills connect the Saguache and San Juan Mountain Ranges and is home to lynx, bear, elk, and the occasional moose. Because of its gentle grades and lower elevation,the Cochetopa Hills should be a respite for CDT/CT Travelers between the high mountains of Central Colorado and the Weminuche and South San Juan mountain ranges. 

Instead, the CDT/CT in the area follows various roads and trails. The "trail" varies from narrow motorized trail routes  to full-size vehicle roads.  Many segments are located well below the physical continental divide, and have little or no resemblance to a true “Continental Divide National Scenic Trail.”  

Once complete, the project will:  

  • create a destination that will provide more experiences for hikers and horseback riders to access to the CDT/CT;
  • create locations for overnight use;  
  • provide an economic draw for the surrounding communities;  
  • provide facilities that will increase public information;
  • and create more opportunities for a families to access and connect to the CDT/CT and the Continental Divide.  

What is the Scope of Work?

This project will construct 32 miles of new non-motorized CDT/CT from Lujan Pass to the La Garita Mountains, in the Cochetopa Hills of Colorado.  This section is being designed for hiking and horseback riding.  The final NEPA decision regarding the project is expected over the winter and at that time, how additional uses will be addressed or which uses will be allowed on the segment, will be determined.  It is expected that the public process will be complete by June 2015, and construction can begin as soon as that process is completed.   The project timeline below is estimated and will ultimately be determined by the issuance of a final decision.  These funds are project specific and will be available as soon as work is able to start and allows the project partners to begin work in this field season versus waiting an additional field season to begin work.  Work will entail:
  • In early-late July 2015, Southwest Conservation Corps  (SCC) will clear the 32 mile long Corridor.  
  • In late July 2015, Tony Boone Trails, a Salida, CO based trail construction contractor, will “rough” in the Trail with Baby Flo', his trail machine.  
  • In September 2015 the first of 12 crews will begin to "finish" the 32 mile long Trail.  This component will continue through the Summer of 2016.
The Volunteer  work will be accomplished through partnership with: Colorado Trail Foundation (CTF), Volunteers for Outdoor Colorado (VOC), Colorado Mountain Club (CMC),  Back Country Horsemen- Colorado Chapter (BCHA-CO), and other local trail groups.  CDTC will also partner with CMC to provide a Youth Stewardship crew to serve as technical advisors during corridor clearing and volunteer partner efforts. 

Project Map:


How will the Funding Be Used?

The overall project cost totals $200,000.  This includes $170,000 to pay for the Contractor, $10,000 to cover volunteer meal costs, and $20,000 to cover the CMC stewardship crew.  We have requested $180,000 of those funds through multiple funding sources. All of the funders require  10% of the project costs ($20,000) in Cash to leverage the funds we've requested.   These are project specific funds and will only be used to fund project specific work. In addition to these funds, our partners have committed these "in kind" matching funds:

  • The USFS has allocated $75,000 to the Rio Grande NF for the SCC crew work, covering the costs of port-o-johns for volunteer projects, and field support. 
  • The Colorado Mountain Club has committed a match of $19,500 for the Stewardship crew. 
  • Tony Boone Trails is donating $50,000 in kind staff time and labor in costs to the project.

Outcomes:

With all combined funds (partners and CDTC), we will have leveraged $365,000 into the following outcomes:

  • We will build 32 miles of new non-motorized CDT;
  • We will install 3 new Trailheads;
  • We will employ local businesses from Salida and Saguache, Colorado; 
  • We will train and engage local youth in the stewardship of the CDT;
  • We will support over 300 volunteers from the CTF, VOC, BCHA and the CDTC to work over 470 volunteer days resulting in 3,760 volunteer hours worth $84,788 in volunteer labor;
  • We will build a strong and diverse CDT Community committed to its stewardship in perpetuity;
  • And, we will move the CDT off of roads and away from motorized use and enjoy a Trail Experience consistent with National Scenic Trail designation and for which the CDT was created.

Who is the Continental Divide Trail Coalition (CDTC):

On May 21, 2013, the CDTC launched an Indiegogo Campaign entitled "Finding Our Way on the Continental Divide" and invited you to help us build a grassroots community to protect, preserve, and promote the CDT. You answered our call and helped us reach and exceed our goal. CDTC formed to establish strong community based relationships through activities that support the construction, maintenance and preservation of the CDT, and because of your support, in just 1.5 years, we have achieved the following:

  1. On May 21, 2014, CDTC  became the lead National Partner working with the US Forest Service, National Park Service, and Bureau of Land Management through our official Memorandum of Understanding (MOU) with the Federal agencies;
  2. Since June 2013, our volunteers have contributed over 22,000 volunteer hours at value of $496,100 to support the stewardship of the CDT;
  3. We launched our Gateway Community Program and have 3 Designated Communities: Silver City, NM; Cuba,NM; and Chama, NM, and 3 more ready to go!
  4. We launched our Adopt-A-Trail Program to engage our local communities in the stewardship of the CDT and support its users and have over 350 miles of CDT under Adopter Agreements in 6 areas along the Trail;
  5. Our volunteers and partners have built over 10 miles of the CDT, maintained and signed over 350 miles of the CDT, and are ready for much much more!

Perks:

$10: Stick it: On your water bottle, your mug, your car, your lap top, where ever you want people to know you "Braved the CDT".  

                                 

$15//CDT Schwag: Get everything you need to proudly display your CDT Love....This includes a CDTC Sticker, CDT Sticker, and a CDT Trail marker. This way you can wear it, tag it, stick it, and show your love every way possible! You'll also receive  a free one (1) year membership (or renewal) to CDTC.


                                                          

$25//No "App" Needed.....With this physical map on your wall, how can you not dream of the Trail everyday and your next adventure along the "Backbone of America?" This map hangs on your wall and won't get lost on your smart phone. You'll also get the CDT Schwag and a 1-year membership to the CDTC.

$50//Brave It!: From our great partners at Hikertrash, we have a special edition and specially designed "Brave the CDT" T-shirt, and Plus-you get the CDT and CDTC Stickers and CDTC Membership.

                      

$50//Keep the Dawgs Happy: From our partners at Point6 Socks, you will receive a pair of the newly created CDT Socks.  Designed with a CDT traveler mind. These socks are 100 % wool made from happy sheep in Tennessee.  Happy Sheep mean happy feet! You'll also get the CDT and CDTC Stickers and CDTC Membership.

                                 
                 

$50//Get your own cattle trough: Well, not really, but from our friends at Vapur, we have this specially designed collapsible water bottle. Not only will it keep you hydrated when you're out on your next CDT Adventure, it's light weight, easy to clean, and functional! Plus-you'll also get the CDT and CDTC Stickers and CDTC Membership.

                            

    
$75//CDT Dreamer: Get your own 2015 CDT calendar featuring some of the most amazing images that will help you dream up your next big CDT Adventure.  (Santa says this is his favorite perk!) You'll also get a CDT full length map, as well as the CDT and CDTC stickers and CDTC Membership.


 

$100//The Triple Crown of CDT Gear: Get one of each of the "Brave the CDT" T-shirt, a pair of point 6 socks, and a Vapur Water Bottle and a .  All you'll need after this is a new pack! You'll also get the CDT and CDTC Stickers and CDTC Membership.

                                      


$100//Get Charmed by the CDT: From our good friend She Moves Jewelry, as part of this perk you will get to choose from one of the wide selection of charms that show your love of not just the CDT but many of the other great long distance trails out there. You'll also get the CDT and CDTC Stickers and CDTC Membership.(Hint Hint, this would make a great holiday gift for your special someone) 

                            

$100//From Couch to CDT: With these three great videos, you can cozy up on your couch, and fuel your dreams of a journey on the backbone of America! With Lawton "Disco" Grinter's: "Walkumentary", Shane "Jester" O'Donnell's: "Embrace the Brutality, and Mark Flagler's: "Walking the Great Divide"- you'll experience the CDT through 3 different lenses.  You can watch the movies while wearing your Brave the CDT shirt, which along with the CDT Schwag and CDTC Membership, are also included

                                      

$200//A Night with Tony Furtado: Here's a great perk for any one who loves  music.   Tony Furtado, one of the true craftsman in the Americana music scene and our official CDTC Troubadour, is helping our campaign by offering a pair of tickets to each of his shows along the CDT. You'll get tickets to your choice of his January 14, 2015 show in Santa Fe, NM, January 16, 2015  show in Salida, CO, and January 17, 2015 show in Denver, CO. The perk also includes 2 of our CDT Beer Tumblers, the stickers, and a CDTC Membership.


$500//Put a Ring on it: Make a commitment to the CDT and sponsor a 1-mile section of the 32 miles of the CDT we are building! You'll get a map of your 1-mile section, a map of the entire project, and a full length map of the entire CDT!  Plus we'll recognize all donors on the CDT Interactive map at the location of your mile.Of course, you'll also get a CDT Calendar, stickers, and a 1- year complimentary membership to CDTC.


$1000//A Walk in the Woods: With nearly 100,000 miles between them all, Bill Bryson has nothing on Cam "Swami" Honan (www.thehikinglife.com), Liz "Snorkel" Thomas (www.eathomas.com), and Paul "Mags" Magnanti (www.pmags.com).  Three of the best out there, you will get the chance to hike with these three on an overnight hike along the CDT and have them share their wisdom of hiking, gear choices, nutrition, and you'll get to witness their sense of humor, which is probably how they've been able to hike all those miles! THE HIKE WILL BE IN SEPTEMBER 2015.

Major Sponsors:

A huge thank you to our event and campaign sponsors!

Point 6, Vapur, Salazon Chocolate, Hikertrash, Mountainsmith, Mountain Khakis, Fate Brewing Co, Salomon, Tony Boone Trails,  The Trail Show,  Wildfire Pottery, ULA Equipment, Walk2Connect, Bear Creek Survey, Flagler Films, Tony Furtado, Montbell, Gossamer Gear, TBW Productions, Renee Patrick LLC, GutHook Apps and High Sierra Attitude,Cindy Ross

Campaign & Communications Partners:

Thank you to our partners!

Back Country Horseman of America (BCHA), Southwest Conservation Corps, Volunteers for Outdoor Colorado, Colorado Mountain Club, American Hiking Society, Aldha West,  The Hiking Life, The Real Hiking Viking, Erin "Wired" Saver, Kate "drop-N-roll" Hoch, Shane "Jester" O'Donnell, Lindsay "Marmot" Malone, and Renee "She-ra" Patrick

Other Ways You Can Help:

Become a CDTC Member! Consider becoming a long-term supporter and friend with the Continental Divide Trail Coaltion as we work to preserve and protect this incredible corridor and trail. See here for details!

Be a campaign sharing champion! We need ALL the help we can get in regards to sharing this campaign with all who have benefited from being on our beautiful trails.  Please consider doing one or all of the following throughout our 45 day campaign!

Share our campaign:

- On Facebook / with a photo of the CDT
- On Twitter / use #BravetheCDT and #TheNext32 & include @CDNST1
- In emails to your friends and family
- With any hikers, writers, bloggers, outdoor magazines & publications
- Create photos and flyers and post at local retail shops / ask us for content!

Hiked on the CDT? Share your photos and stories with us!  You can email them to info@continentaldividetrail.org

Video & Image Credits:

Music: Tony Furtado
Video Editing: Wesley Trimble
Photo Credits: Tom "The Real Hiking Viking"Gathman, Ryan "the Tourist" Choi, Eric Herbst, Paul "Pmags" Magnanti, Jon Pierson, Kerry Shakarjian,  Teresa Martinez, David Dolton, Stephanie Friday-Allen, CDTC stock images

Our volunteers and partners have built over 10 miles of the CDT, maintained and signed over 350 miles of the CDT, and are ready for much much more!





Perks:


$10: Stick it: On your water bottle, your mug, your car, your lap top, where ever you want people to know you "Braved the CDT".  



                                         

$15//CDT Schwag: Get everything you need to proudly
display your CDT Love....This includes a CDTC Sticker, CDT Sticker, and a CDT
Trail marker. This way you can wear it, tag it, stick it, and show your love
every way possible! You'll also receive  a free one (1) year membership
(or renewal) to CDTC.                                                          $25//No "App" Needed.....With this physical map on your wall, how can you not dream of the Trail everyday and your next adventure along the "Backbone of America?" This map hangs on your wall and won't get lost on your smart phone. You'll also get the CDT Schwag and a 1-year membership to the CDTC.

$50//Brave It!: From our great partners at Hikertrash, we have a special
edition and specially designed "Brave the CDT" T-shirt, and Plus-you get the CDT and CDTC Stickers
and CDTC Membership.                      



$50//Keep the Dawgs Happy: From our partners at Point6 Socks, you will receive a pair
of the newly created CDT Socks.  Designed with a CDT
traveler mind. These socks are 100 % wool made from happy sheep in
Tennessee.  Happy Sheep mean happy feet! You'll also get the CDT and CDTC
Stickers and CDTC Membership.

                                                  
$50//Get your own cattle trough: Well, not really, but from our friends at Vapur, we have
this specially designed collapsible water bottle. Not only will it keep you
hydrated when you're out on your next CDT Adventure, it's light weight, easy to
clean, and functional! Plus-you'll also get the CDT and CDTC Stickers and CDTC
Membership.
                                    


    
$75//CDT Dreamer: Get your own 2015 CDT calendar featuring some of the most
amazing images that will help you dream up your next big CDT Adventure. 
(Santa says this is his favorite perk!) You'll also get a CDT full length map,
as well as the CDT and CDTC stickers and CDTC Membership.
 $100//The Triple Crown of CDT Gear: Get one of each of the "Brave the CDT" T-shirt, a pair of point 6 socks,
and a Vapur Water Bottle and a .  All you'll need after
this is a new pack! You'll also get the CDT and CDTC Stickers and CDTC
Membership.
                                              

$100//Get Charmed by the CDT: From our good friend She Moves Jewelry, as
part of this perk you will get to choose from one of the wide selection of
charms that show your love of not just the CDT but many of the other great long
distance trails out there. You'll also get the CDT and CDTC Stickers and CDTC
Membership.(Hint Hint, this would make a great holiday gift for your special someone) 

                            

$100//From Couch to CDT:
With these three great videos, you can cozy up on your couch, and fuel your
dreams of a journey on the backbone of America! With Lawton "Disco"
Grinter's: "Walkumentary", Shane "Jester" O'Donnell's: "Embrace the Brutality, and Mark Flagler's: "Walking the Great Divide"- you'll experience
the CDT through 3 different lenses.  You can watch the movies while
wearing your Brave the CDT shirt, which along with the CDT Schwag and CDTC
Membership, are also included 
                                              $200//A Night with Tony Furtado: Here's a great perk for any one who
loves  music.   Tony Furtado, one of the true craftsman in the Americana music scene and our official CDTC Troubadour, is helping our campaign by offering a pair of tickets to each of his shows along the CDT. You'll get tickets to your choice of his January 14, 2015
show in Santa Fe, NM, January 16, 2015  show in Salida, CO, and January
17, 2015 show in Denver, CO. The perk also includes 2 of our CDT Beer Tumblers,
the stickers, and a CDTC Membership.

$500//Put a Ring on it: Make a commitment to the CDT and sponsor a
1-mile section of the 32 miles of the CDT we are building! You'll get a map of
your 1-mile section, a map of the entire project, and a full length map of the
entire CDT!  Plus we'll recognize all donors on the CDT Interactive map at
the location of your mile.Of course, you'll also get a CDT Calendar, stickers,
and a 1- year complimentary membership to CDTC.$1000//A Walk in the Woods: With nearly 100,000 miles between them all, Bill Bryson has
nothing on Cam "Swami" Honan (www.thehikinglife.com), Liz "Snorkel" Thomas (www.eathomas.com), and
Paul "Mags" Magnanti (www.pmags.com).  Three of the best out there, you will get
the chance to hike with these three on an overnight hike along the CDT and have
them share their wisdom of hiking, gear choices, nutrition, and you'll get to
witness their sense of humor, which is probably how they've been able to hike
all those miles! THE HIKE WILL BE IN SEPTEMBER 2015.Major Sponsors:A huge thank you to our event and campaign sponsors!Point 6, Vapur, Salazon Chocolate, Hikertrash, Mountainsmith, Mountain Khakis, Fate Brewing Co, Salomon, Tony Boone Trails,  The Trail Show,  Wildfire Pottery, ULA Equipment, Walk2Connect, Bear Creek Survey, Flagler Films, Tony Furtado, Montbell, Gossamer Gear, TBW Productions, Renee Patrick LLC, GutHook Apps and High Sierra Attitude,Cindy RossCampaign & Communications Partners:Thank you to our partners!Back Country Horseman of America (BCHA), Southwest Conservation Corps, Volunteers for Outdoor Colorado, Colorado Mountain Club, American Hiking Society, Aldha West,  The Hiking Life, The Real Hiking Viking, Erin "Wired" Saver, Kate "drop-N-roll" Hoch, Shane "Jester" O'Donnell, Lindsay "Marmot" Malone, and Renee "She-ra" PatrickOther Ways You Can Help:Become a CDTC Member! Consider becoming a long-term supporter and friend with the Continental Divide Trail Coaltion as we work to preserve and protect this incredible corridor and trail. See here for details!Be a campaign sharing champion! We need ALL the help we can get in regards to sharing this campaign with all who have benefited from being on our beautiful trails.  Please consider doing one or all of the following throughout our 45 day campaign!Share our campaign:- On Facebook / with a photo of the CDT- On Twitter / use #BravetheCDT and #TheNext32 & include @CDNST1- In emails to your friends and family- With any hikers, writers, bloggers, outdoor magazines & publications- Create photos and flyers and post at local retail shops / ask us for content!Hiked on the CDT? Share your photos and stories with us!  You can email them to info@continentaldividetrail.orgVideo & Image Credits:Music: Tony FurtadoVideo Editing: Wesley TrimblePhoto Credits: Tom "The Real Hiking Viking"Gathman, Ryan "the Tourist" Choi, Eric Herbst, Paul "Pmags" Magnanti, Jon Pierson, Kerry Shakarjian,  Teresa Martinez, David Dolton, Stephanie Friday-Allen, CDTC stock images

story:
Hi,

My name is Justin Bowles, The inventor of the puppy pal water bottle and the owner of the smart athlete. This campaign is important to me because I put everything I had into the business and now need the money for the first round of sales. I appreciate the interest in my product as well as growing the business and hiring new employees.

PORTABLE & CONVENIENT : The Puppy Pal Water Bottle is a unique combination of both a water bottle and a pet bowl.

Through exhaustive research and feedbacks, we came up with a size which is both practical and usable. Measuring 6.1 inches in width and 11.6 inches in height , the bottle and the bowl sections can be separated.

The bottle holds up to 35 fluid ounces of water , and the bowl holds up to 15 fluid ounces of water or 5 cups of dog food. You can be assured that with this product, you will be all set for a fun day out with your pet with this unique containment system.

- SAFE MATERIALS AND ECO-FRIENDLY : Made with high quality flexible Food-Grade PETG, 100% lead free, BPA free, FDA approved. You also can rest assured that when your pet is enjoying food or water from one of our bowls they're completely safe from toxins, and so are you

- DURABLE AND REUSABLE: The bowl's durable PETG plastic construction means that they can be rinsed or wiped clean after use. This also gives the bowl greater longevity over other similar products .

- EASY FOR STORAGE AND TRANSPORTATION: Non-Slip collapsible dog bowl is great for travel. The Bowl has a ring shaped handle, and this will conveniently allow you to hook up to your backpack , dog travel crate or stroller. well size & weight for hiking and camping .

- Unique Color Combinations: it is available in mixed color combinations so you too can express your individualism

- Warranty: We are so confident that you will enjoy our product for many years to come that we stand behind every product sold with a lifetime warranty.

regards

Justin Bowles

story:
L'evento

La giornata di pulizia del Parco Commodilla vuole essere una giornata all'insegna della partecipazione attiva di cittadini e asociazioni del quartiere. Con l'obiettivo non solo di mantenere fruibile il Parco Commodilla ma anche sensibilizzare le Istituzioni verso una soluzione per molte aree verdi del Comune di Roma, che rappresentano luoghi di aggregazione sociale, di svago per i più piccoli e per gli amici a quattro zampe.

  • L'evento è organizzato dal Comitato Parco Giovannipoli, nato nel marzo del 2013 proprio con l'obiettivo di mantenere fruibile quest'area verde, che al suo interno ospita le Catacombe di Commodilla e resti di antiche mura romane.
  • Vogliamo organizzare uan giornata di partecipazione, tra amici in un'atmosfera di festa e di impegn civile. Basato sulla collaborazione e la solidarietà. Saranno con noi per l'occasione diverse realtà di quartiere come Casetta Rossa, CSOA La Strada, Legambiente Garbatella, gli Orti Urbani di Garbatella, il CESV e La Comunità. Insieme per Commodilla, in rappresentanze di tutte le aree verdi romane ancora senza regolare tutela e manutenzione.
  • Sostenere il nostro progetto vuol dire non solo partecipare ma anche contribuire ad una grande giornata di partecipazione e sensibilizzazione, che vedra coinvolti adulti e bambini.

Di cosa abbiamo biosgno e cosa puoi fare tu

  • Abbiamo bisogno di 600 euro per acquistare parte dell'attrezzatura da giardino necessaria alle attività di manutenzione, necessarie, non soloper l'evento in oggetto, ma anche per tutte le altre settimane che i Volontari del Comitato Parco Giovannipoli svolgono le attività di manutenzione ordinaria. Abbiamo bisogno di scope, rastrelli, cesoie, forbici, pale, teli, pale e anche di un tagliaerba manuale. 
  • se non raggiungeremo l'obiettivo finale, i soldi raccolti verranno comunque utilizzati per questo obiettivo, acquisteremo quanti più attrezzi possibili.
  • aiutare il Comitato Parco Giovannipoli vuol dire non solo aiutare il Parco Commodilla e i volontari nella loro oopera di manutenzione, ma anche le altre realtà di quartiere che potranno contare su questa attrezzatura, che verrà messa a disposizioni per le esigenze del quartiere.


Altri modi per aiutarci

Vorresti aiutarci e non sai come come:

  • Abbiamo bisogno di volontari per le giornate di pulizia, per pulire i cestini e molto altro!

story:
About POOP BOX

POOP BOX is a cardboard box specifically designed for collecting your dog’s waste. Its design allows to collect waste without directly feeling the waste in your hand. POOP BOX makes picking your dogs waste from all kind of surfaces, even grass, clean and simple. And of course cardboard is much more environmentally friendly to Earth than plastic bags.


How it works

Place the box securely over your dogs waste, grab everything by closing the box and throw it in a garbage can. To see POOP BOX in action please watch the video above.


What's the story behind POOP BOX and to whom it may be useful

I was psychologically uncomfortable to pick the dogs waste using plastic bag, I felt like picking it up bare handed, so I came up with POOP BOX. If you have same problem then POOP BOX is for you.


Why we need your support

We need your support to make this happen! 

We have finished the development of POOP BOX for small dogs. We will use the money raised on Indiegogo to design large size POOP BOX for bigger dogs and to produce minimum quantities that manufacturer requires. Without your contribution, we cannot afford to provide sufficient funds, so please donate!


Project timeline

November - January: making a lot of new Indiegogo friends

January - February: designing medium and large size POOP BOX

March: manufacturing and shipping

For POOP BOX updates you can also follow our facebook page www.facebook.com/poopbox


Other ways you can help

If you can't see yourself using POOP BOX, you can still help by ordering it for someone else who could use this product, or by sharing this fundraising campaign with all your friends and followers. Thank you very much for your support!

story:
Short Summary

With the period 5 months, FLIFLY supports plastic bag biogas, flashlight solar, hand light and table light solar for 50 poor farmers who are members of Credit Unions and Sustainable Agriculture Communities that are under promotion under FLIFLY. They are living in Keansvay district, Kandal Province, Cambodia.

What We Need & What You Get


There are 50 poor farmers have good cookers and light for their families, saving money reduce using chemical fertilizers, good environment around their houses, generate more income through using organic fertilizer for their vegetable and have time for running other business. They have good health and happiness as well as involve to launch climate change.

 

The Impact

50 poor farmers who are members of credit unions and sustainable communities that are under promotion by FLIFLY. They cannot use electricity by low income per-monthly under 100 US$. This campaign will help them for reduce their expenses and have time to making other business for increasing their income for supporting their families. It is the part for launch climate change to launch poverty of farmers and  contribute to the United Nations Millennium Development Goals (Goal 7: Ensure Environmental Sustainability).

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We are the most appropriate for transfer your fund to our bank account at below:

story:
Our Story

I have built a redesign of Nikola Tesla`s steam turbine (see youtube video).

The best features about this turbine are the simplicity of it`s design. My goal would be to power this turbine with a wood burner (Carbon neutral fuel) and provide a minimum of 1200 watts of electricity. The steam could then be condensed and utilized as drinking water.

The Impact

The impact of such a device could be of global scale (as Tesla would word this).  A large portion of the global population has to live without electricity and without safe drinking water. This automatically means that large portions of the global population are unable to join a global economy or rely on the use of gasoline and other traditional expensive fuels. They also rely on open flame wood fires within their homes for heating or cooking, resulting in major health consequences.

My goal is to develop a prototype, a working model of a downdraft wood burner made of steel so I can test the size of the burner. The burner will have provisions for a stainless steel boiler to be inserted into the center of the burner to provide as much steam as required to power the turbine (electrical power).

The burner could be fed by a large variety of fuels such as pelleted grass clippings, leaves, twigs or shredded wood, all these fuels are readily available almost all over the globe.

This is a project 6 years in the making. The development and construction of the my turbine have eaten large portion of my savings and hopefully I can accelerate the development of this burner by reaching out to others. The shortest way to describe this project is a mix out of a Downdraft Wood Gasifier and Tesla turbine. The reason I don’t just go and buy a steam boiler is there are significant advantages to using a downdraft burner design when interested in exhaust emission and temperature and the char effect of the fuel to be consumed.

This raises the burn temperature and allows to run a internal combustion engine on the same burner. This would multiply the electrical output when needed during peak times. These advantages will result in a better efficiency of the unit as a hole and raise the electrical capacity.

Anybody interested in joining my campaign feel free to contact me anytime.

The project is located in Oklahoma.



What We Need & What You Get

My burner will not be big in size my goal is to built a unit about 3 ft tall total overall measurement so my burner has to stay small in size. i have a local machine shop that has been building all of my turbine pieces.

i need funds to purchase stainless steel rotor disks  to take my turbine to a non rusting state. my current discs are made of regular steel they are fully functional mark up discs.

i also need funds to purchase solenoid valves of different sizes, pressure relieve valves, pressure gauges. (they are not cheap)

i also have to buy the steel and some hardware, to built a bracket that will hold the alternator and turbine. tableclamps wont do.

i also have to get some plexiglas to keep splashwater away from electronics.

my ultimate goal will be to fully automate this unit with my siemens PLC S7-200 controller.

The electrical side of this unit will be the easy side for me, since i have 15 years of experience in the field as a journeymen electrician.


You will get updates via you tube of all my builds and if interested you could join me for a trail or test run here in Oklahoma.

This is definitely one of a kind project, thanks for reading God bless.


The Goal of My Project and Group


The ultimate goal is to provide a fully automatic grid tie ready electrical generator for sale. These units could send online data reports for notification when they need to be refilled as well as trouble calls or cleaning intervals. These unit shall be designed to sell to homeowners, apartment complexes, or warehouses where these systems will reduce waste and current operational costs. By reducing utility costs, this will allow resources to be available for donation to our cause. This will always be a big thriving force to ensure our success and the continuation of our mission.
 
Currently most energy we consume is generated in a far distanced power plant where heat is wasted in large cooling towers and sent into the atmosphere. By eliminating transmission cost and wasted heat, we can reduce utility cost between 30-50% depending on how much heat can be used locally.


Best case scenario would be that your donations to our cause would be a tax deduction to your benefit. This is not the case as of right now. With this in mind we will keep a open record of all spending of donated money. This way you can judge for yourself if we handled you money appropriately. If you would ever feel like we did not spend your money properly, I encourage you to send me an email. I will personally send you an accounting of the expenses.


Many companies in recent years have invested in generators to ensure electrical supply during outages. Some of these generators could be operated on bio-waste instead of natural gas. Bio waste could be donated for free and yield savings on gas utility bills. Lawn care companies pay to get rid of grass clippings, which could easily be pressed into pellets and stored for further use as fuel.

About Me

I was born in Germany in 1980 and raised by my German mother and American father. I am the 3rd youngest of 8 children and I have lots of nieces and nephews. I am a newlywed and was married just this year to my best friend and beautiful wife. I learned the electrical trade in German trade school, which has given me the capability to design a Grid tie Generator. When I turned 23 years old I relocated to Oklahoma, where I continued to work as a electrical journeyman.
I discovered my passion for teaching as a foreman on large job sites where I always had a leading/teaching position. In 2005, I developed a passion for Tesla turbines due to the primitive design and ease of assembly. I have always had a passion for alternative energies, ever since I had nuclear physics in 9th grade. I just could not wrap my head around how long this waste will continue to pollute  the planet.
The build of a wood-gasifier started as a hobby project. My first one was two 55 gallon drums stacked on top of each other, quite a large operation. Gasifiers were first developed in WW2 so it is a rather forgotten technology as well as the Tesla turbine. Oil shortages during WW2 forced the development of this technology. Many people claim to have free energy devices these days. This is nothing but smoke and mirrors, let me tell you. Physics applies to everything, you can not generate energy but you can convert it to a usable form.

My Philosophy

Let me show you how you can save some money and free up some energy and resources. By reducing operational costs this will allow resources to be available for donation to our cause. This will always be a big thriving force to ensure our success and the continuation of our mission. It will just blow your mind how many resources end up on a landfill that could still be processed in my turbine and still make you money.
It took a long time to develop a car as it is driven today. Development times are long and expensive but if you compare any current model automobile with a 1932 ford model T  you would agree the comfort was worth it to keep researching, even thou i love old cars and trucks.

They also rely on open flame wood fires within their homes for
heating or cooking, resulting in major health consequences.
My goal is to develop a prototype, a working model of a downdraft
wood burner made of steel  so I can test the size of the burner. The
burner will have provisions for a stainless steel boiler to be
inserted into the center of the burner to provide as much steam as
required to power the turbine (electrical power).
The burner could be fed by a large variety of fuels such as
pelleted grass clippings, leaves, twigs or shredded wood, all these
fuels are readily available almost all over the globe.   

This is a project 6 years in the making. The development and
construction of the my turbine have eaten large portion of my savings
and hopefully I can accelerate the development of this burner by
reaching out to others. The shortest way to describe this project is
a mix out of a Downdraft
Wood Gasifier and Tesla
turbine. The reason I don’t just go and buy a steam boiler is
there are significant advantages to using a downdraft burner design
when interested in exhaust emission and temperature and the char
effect of the fuel to be consumed. 

This raises the burn temperature and allows to run a internal
combustion engine on the same burner. This would multiply the
electrical output when needed during peak times. These advantages
will result in a better efficiency of the unit as a hole and raise
the electrical capacity.
Anybody interested in joining my campaign feel free to contact me
anytime.
The project is located in Oklahoma. 


What We Need & What You Get
My burner will not be big in size my goal is to built a unit about 3 ft tall total overall measurement so my burner has to stay small in size. i have a local machine shop that has been building all of my turbine pieces.i need funds to purchase stainless steel rotor disks  to take my turbine to a non rusting state. my current discs are made of regular steel they are fully functional mark up discs. i also need funds to purchase solenoid valves of different sizes, pressure relieve valves, pressure gauges. (they are not cheap)i also have to buy the steel and some hardware, to built a bracket that will hold the alternator and turbine. tableclamps wont do.i also have to get some plexiglas to keep splashwater away from electronics.my ultimate goal will be to fully automate this unit with my siemens PLC S7-200 controller.The electrical side of this unit will be the easy side for me, since i have 15 years of experience in the field as a journeymen electrician.You will get updates via you tube of all my builds and if interested you could join me for a trail or test run here in Oklahoma. This is definitely one of a kind project, thanks for reading God bless.The Goal of My Project and GroupThe
 ultimate goal is to provide a fully automatic grid tie ready electrical
 generator for sale. These units could send online data reports for 
notification when they need to be refilled as well as trouble calls 
or cleaning intervals. These unit shall be designed to sell to 
homeowners, apartment complexes, or warehouses where these systems will 
reduce waste and current operational costs. By reducing utility costs, 
this will allow resources to be available for donation to our cause. 
This will always be a big thriving force to ensure our success and the 
continuation of our mission.  Currently
 most energy we consume is generated in a far distanced power plant 
where heat is wasted in large cooling towers and sent into the 
atmosphere. By eliminating transmission cost and wasted heat, we can 
reduce utility cost between 30-50% depending on how much heat can be 
used locally. Best
 case scenario would be that your donations to our cause would be a tax 
deduction to your benefit. This is not the case as of right now. With 
this in mind we will keep a open record of all spending of donated 
money. This way you can judge for yourself if we handled you money 
appropriately. If you would ever feel like we did not spend your money 
properly, I encourage you to send me an email. I will personally send 
you an accounting of the expenses. Many
 companies in recent years have invested in generators to ensure 
electrical supply during outages. Some of these generators could be 
operated on bio-waste instead of natural gas. Bio waste could be donated
 for free and yield savings on gas utility bills. Lawn care companies 
pay to get rid of grass clippings, which could easily be pressed into 
pellets and stored for further use as fuel. About Me I
 was born in Germany in 1980 and raised by my German mother and American
 father. I am the 3rd youngest of 8 children and I have lots of nieces 
and nephews. I am a newlywed and was married just this year to my best 
friend and beautiful wife. I learned the electrical trade in German 
trade school, which has given me the capability to design a Grid tie 
Generator. When I turned 23 years old I relocated to Oklahoma, where I 
continued to work as a electrical journeyman. I
 discovered my passion for teaching as a foreman on large job sites 
where I always had a leading/teaching position. In 2005, I developed a 
passion for Tesla turbines due to the primitive design and ease of 
assembly. I have always had a passion for alternative energies, ever 
since I had nuclear physics in 9th grade. I just could not wrap my head 
around how long this waste will continue to pollute  the planet. The
 build of a wood-gasifier started as a hobby project. My first one was 
two 55 gallon drums stacked on top of each other, quite a large 
operation. Gasifiers were first developed in WW2 so it is a rather 
forgotten technology as well as the Tesla turbine. Oil shortages during 
WW2 forced the development of this technology. Many people claim to have
 free energy devices these days. This is nothing but smoke and mirrors, 
let me tell you. Physics applies to everything, you can not generate 
energy but you can convert it to a usable form.My PhilosophyLet
 me show you how you can save some money and free up some energy and 
resources. By reducing operational costs this will allow resources to be
 available for donation to our cause. This will always be a big thriving
 force to ensure our success and the continuation of our mission. It 
will just blow your mind how many resources end up on a landfill that 
could still be processed in my turbine and still make you money. It
 took a long time to develop a car as it is driven today. Development 
times are long and expensive but if you compare any current model 
automobile with a 1932 ford model T  you would agree the comfort was 
worth it to keep researching, even thou i love old cars and trucks.

story:
Six years ago I travelled to Africa, and it changed my life.  I now have the opportunity to return to Africa, and hopefully return the favor.  As many of you know, I "trek" several miles each day bringing nursing care to my homebound patients in Manhattan.  In January, 2012, I will be joining a group of women trekking to the top of Mount Kilimanjaro, the tallest free standing mountain on earth, in an effort to raise money to construct a water reservoir for a community in need in Northern Kenya.

Specifically my group is raising money for The Ol Malo Foundation Inc. (registered as a 501(c)3 charity in the US), whose mission is to provide clean, safe water to the Samburu population and their livestock.  The plight of this community in drought stricken northern Kenya is serious, and together we can make a tangible difference.  My group is seeking to raise $25,000 to cover the cost of building one reservoir, which is a small price to pay for clean, safe water.Ken

Whether you can give $10 or $10,000 dollars, every little bit helps.  Think about how much you spend on fancy bottled water.  Could you give it up for a day, a week, or a month and donate what you save?    Please, spread the word and tell your friends!  If 1250 people give $10, we are halfway to a reservoir!  And if that's not enough, check out the perks!  And don't forget to choose a perk when you check out.  Thank you!

story:
Every kid remembers receiving their first bike, but many grow up without this memory. For some families the reality of such a purchase is simply out of their reach. 

It's good people like you who graciously help us make their wishes come true. Because every kid deserves a bike...

And thanks to some amazing people 10 kids from our school received bikes under their Christmas tree last year. I can't express in words the joy on their faces when they saw what Santa brought them. 

http://d3j5vwomefv46c.cloudfront.net/photos/large/829074591.jpg?1387743612

Now we would love to make another 10 kids happy, this time a kindergarten class. We would love the Easter Bunny to get them a bike.  If you can help, please do.

Thank you!

story:
A robot that plants trees...

Robots? Trees? That's right, the TreeRover is a tree planting robot with one goal: to plant trees for you! It is the brainchild of two UVic electrical engineering students, Nick Birch and Tyler Rhodes, who together form Iota Enterprises. Their passion for the environment and sustainable technologies drove them to take four months off school to build a tree planting robot!

The TreeRover

How you can help...

We currently have a working prototype, but now need your help to continue. The TreeRover needs technical upgrades to make it a bigger, smarter, stronger tree planting machine!

We require $5000 in order to improve the TreeRover in the following areas:


What you get...

In return for your support the TreeRover will plant a tree for you or someone you dedicate it to! Please be sure to select one of the listed perks to ensure your tree gets planted. When your tree has been planted we will send you a video clip showing the TreeRover putting YOUR tree in the ground! You will be able to share this clip with your friends to show off the fact that YOU Added a Tree to the Earth!

For those of you who can contribute more we are offering exclusive TreeRover merchandise, including: 
  • An engraved pocket knife 
  • A wood coaster/potholder set
  • A custom designed t-shirt
Laser engraving by: 

T-shirt, knife and coaster set

Please read the individual perk descriptions for more details and see sample pictures of each item in the Image Gallery.

Lets plant some trees!

So please help us push this project forward and add more trees to our beautiful Earth! The TreeRover can't wait to get out there and start planting for you!

For more information about the project please visit our website at:  www.iotaenterprises.com  or take a look at our Youtube Channel for videos of our progress throughout the summer.

We are always accepting all forms of support (tools, equipment, help, suggestions, etc.). You can contact us through our website, www.iotaenterprises.com. We'd love to hear your ideas, thoughts, or advice! And if you are unable to contribute to our Indiegogo campaign, but still want to be a part of this project you can share our campaign page on your social media networks. Thank you!

The TreeRover has been featured on...

story:
Half of the topsoil on the planet has been lost in the last 150 years.

 Our generation is on a cutting edge of a world where transformation seems inevitable.

The desire to help the planet and all living creatures has led us to become part of the solution and not the problem. We are Dimo Stefanov and Boryana- two young and ambitious people who share the same passion for sustainable natural living.

 Organic and sustainable food production is the key to reduce the negative human impact on Earth. The faster we quit synthetic fertilizers, the faster and better chance we have to save soil degeneration and biodiversity.

Our idea is to produce a bio fertilizer pellets that could be dispatched via standard fertilizer spreading machine and therefore be used in big farms with massive production which could totally replace the common use of chemical fertilizers.

The benefits of our 100% pure eco-friendly organic fertilizer are:

1.  Increasing in soil water-retention capacity resulting in increased drought tolerance and irrigation efficiency

2.  Increasing soil nutrient-retention capacity, maximizing plant nutrient uptake

3.  Containing macronutrients: nitrogen, potassium, phosphorus, calcium, sulphur and micronutrients zinc, boron, magnesium, iron, copper, and molybdenum Provides plant hormones such as auxins, gibberellins and cytokinins

4.  Acts as a chelator of nutrients, holding them in the root zone

5.  Boostsorganic matter by 1% increasing drought tolerance by up to 50%

6.  Act as a source of food for increased microbial activity

7.  Granular crumble allow for the use of broadcast fertilizer spreader and a wide application swath

8.  Pellets break down quickly after rain or irrigation

9.  Bio fertilizer pellets will lead to improve the quality and quantity of yield

10. Could be dispatched via standard fertilizer spreading machine and therefore be used in big farms with massive production

Our self-sustainable model would provide not only eco fertilizer, but services as education, recycling local redundant biomass and busyness model to multiply.

 So far we have invested 40 000 EU in land for industrial production, warehouse, front loader tractor, truck, sieving and packing machines, education in organic farming and permaculture. We had settled industrial production of compost. At the farm we are able to produce up to 500 tons of organic fertilizer annually.

 We need a further investment for infrastructural improvements of the warehouse for storage and packing, pellet production line, tip lorry and advertisement.

story:
Invest in RePower Madison

  • Support clean energy!
  • Provide fair utility bills!
  • Reduce dependence on dirty, costly coal!

Short Summary

RePower Madison (RPM) is a citizen group that formed in the summer of 2014 to oppose Madison Gas and Electric's (MGE) proposed billing scheme.   MGE's proposal hurts clean energy and energy efficiency by increasing fixed fees for customers before they even flip on a light switch.  Utilities across the nation are watching the outcome of this regressive billing scheme and Madison area citizens need to take a stand against these proposals that reward the rich and penalize low energy users.

  • RPM opposes MGE’s unfair anti-clean energy policies.
  • RPM is mobilizing citizens to encourage MGE to pursue clean energy.
  • MGE  must see that the Madison area community will not stand for their regressive, anti-clean energy policies, and wants an equitable and sustainable future. 

MGE has pledged to engage its customers to gather feedback before submitting additional billing proposals.  With your help, we will have the resources to wage a strong campaign to promote clean energy and fair billing policies by mobilizing the community and applying public pressure. 

What We Need & What You Get

RePower Madison has public opinion on our side. The Madison area is a progressive community, where we can successfully challenge MGE’s regressive policies, but need financial backing.  Your support will go to:

  • Get the truth out about MGE and their reliance on costly coal.
  • Organize the community to demand better and more fair energy policies.
  • Bring in experts to provide information on alternate directions for MGE.
  • Hold public forums to educate our community on different utility models.
  • Pay for supplies and communications to the public.
  • Show utilities everywhere that they must listen to their customers, not shareholders.

The Impact

MGE's billing scheme was approved by the  Public Service Commission of Wisconsin (PSCW).  Even after public outcry, MGE refused to drop their proposal, but has promised a community conversation to guide its future actions:

  • RPM's initial campaign resulted in a scaled back proposal and public process by MGE. 
  • Higher fixed fees and lower energy rates promotes more energy usage and more pollution, and is unfair to low energy users.  It is a disincentive to saving energy and harms efficiency and solar by reducing the return on investment. 
  • Broad public support for clean energy will encourage  MGE to invest in wind and solar. 
  • A strong public outcry will prevent other utilities from attacking clean energy. 
  • We must take action now to prevent catastrophic effects of climate change.

Risk & Challenges

RPM faces a well-funded opponent (MGE).  The main regulatory body (PSCW) this last fall gave utilities what they wanted in 2-1 decisions. The Republicans control the state government in Wisconsin, which means RPM’s best opportunity to defend clean energy is by targeting MGE directly, rather than through the regulatory process.  

  • MGE is the smallest investor owned utility in Wisconsin.
  • MGE is the smallest investor owned utility in Wisconsin.
  • MGE calls themselves "your community energy company". 
  • Madison is a progressive community that supports clean energy.
  • MGE responded when RPM mobilized citizens to picket MGE and PSCW.
  • PSCW received 1,100+ comments opposing MGE’s billing scheme compared to the average of 15.
  • RPM will drive large and vocal turnout to MGE's community conversations.
  • RPM will ensure MGE cannot ignore the community's support for clean energy.

Other Ways You Can Help

RPM is focused on mobilizing citizens to stand up against the utility industry's nationwide movement against clean energy.  We need people to pay attention and spread information everywhere:

  • First, like our Facebook page: https://www.fb.com/RePowerMadison
  • Next, visit our website: http://repowermadison.org
  • Make sure to subscribe to our emails.
  • Share our Facebook post and website with your friends.
  • Email mitch@repowermadison.org to volunteer.
  • Write a letter to your editor opposing MGE's regressive policies.
  • Sign this petition.
  • Us the Indiegogo share tools to inform others that are interested!

Thank you for your support.  We can do this.

story:
Project Summary

In the Nandamojo river basin, on the Pacific coast of Costa Rica's Guanacaste province, Restoring Our Watershed is working to protect an important ecosystem that has been degraded by decades of misguided land use. A U.S. non-profit, we envision returning the rivers of this valley to year round flow while achieving a sustainable balance between human and natural economies.

Our Bees for Trees program was designed in response to historical, economic and ecological challenges the Nandamojo valley faces. Families who participate are given enough capital to begin producing honey from ten hives. In exchange for their new livelihood, they reforest the 10% of their farm which is most important to watershed health, such as a spring or stream buffer zone. They must also agree to stop using herbicides and pesticides.

ROW supplies new beekeepers with a mix of native species trees to complete the reforestation as well as training in natural honey production. When harvest time comes, we pay a fair price for their honey, accepting loan repayment in product. 

We sell the honey in the local marketplace for a small profit, which is used to fund further restoration work and provide new loans. So far, we have three families in the program and it is proving to be very successful. A typical household can increase their income by about one third while only investing about 10% of their time.

What We Need & What You Get

During 2013, we have two goals for the program. First, we hope to support two new families with loans to become beekeepers. Also, we need capital for research and development of Top-Bar hive technology.

All of our producers currently use Langstroth design hives, which are used almost exclusively in our area. The top bar design, however, can be more affordable and easier to manage. This campaign will provide for a trial run of the Top-Bar hive design tested in the same area vs. Langstroth hives.

Money raised through this campaign will be used in the following ways:

  • $6,000 will provide capital for two $3,000 loans to two new families. 
  • $1,600 will be used for a comparative trial of Top-Bar vs. Langstroth hive designs.

Impact

This project will deliver a triple bottom line return. With these funds, we will be able to:

  • Plant 3,000+ native species trees, representing over seven acres of new forest growth in critical areas. We will include a number of important flowering species in the reforestation mix, supporting native and non-native pollinator populations.
  • Provide two families with a new livelihood, representing at least a 30% increase in their household income.
  • Create a sustainable revenue stream to support further restoration work

Test the viability and productivity of top bar hives in the Nicoya Peninsula and compare results them with Langstroth hives currently used.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please visit www.ourwatershed.org and sign up for our newsletter to find out more about our project and the Bees for Trees initiative.

During 2013, we have two goals for the program. First, we hope to support two new families with loans to become beekeepers. Also, we need capital for research and development of Top-Bar hive technology.
All of our producers currently use Langstroth design hives, which are used almost exclusively in our area. The top bar design, however, can be more affordable and easier to manage. This campaign will provide for a trial run of the Top-Bar hive design tested in the same area vs. Langstroth hives.
Money raised through this campaign will be used in the following ways:

$6,000 will provide capital for two $3,000 loans to two new families. 
$1,600 will be used for a comparative trial of Top-Bar vs. Langstroth hive designs.
Impact
This project will deliver a triple bottom line return. With these funds, we will be able to:

Plant 3,000+ native species trees, representing over seven acres of new forest growth in critical areas. We will include a number of important flowering species in the reforestation mix, supporting native and non-native pollinator populations.
Provide two families with a new livelihood, representing at least a 30% increase in their household income.
Create a sustainable revenue stream to support further restoration work
Test the viability and productivity of top bar hives in the Nicoya Peninsula and compare results them with Langstroth hives currently used.
Other Ways You Can Help
Please visit www.ourwatershed.org and sign up for our newsletter to find out more about our project and the Bees for Trees initiative.
campaign_city: Santa Cruz de Guanacaste, Costa Rica

story:
My son (Steve) and I (John) designed and built the ForestBucker a machine capable to read the personal signature of a tree. We set six goals for the ForestBucker and need contributors to help us to achieve these goals. Please watch the video and read the six goals.

 Once the ForestBucker is running your donation helps to save indigenous forest trees and helps to stop wasting wood of plantation trees. You can help us to tip the balance of the scale from the using of wood from indigenous forest trees to plantation trees that is a renewable source. We need $10 000 to waterproof the electrical and electronic systems of the machine. Please see the different perks for an amount donated. With your help we will be able to get the machine ready within two months and proof how valuable it is to the world. We will keep you informed of our progress on our website and Facebook. If you share our passion about the project you can help us by getting the word out and making some noise about the campaign.

1.  First Goal - What can the ForestBucker do for your country?

saw logs  harvest / year in million m³           

  value of saw logs harvest / year in $million

$s gained with Forest-Bucker for your country per year

USA

          200      

      $10 000 

        $1000 000 000

Brazil

         110

       $5500 

        $550 000 000

Canada

         100

       $5000

        $500 000 000

Russian Fed

          90

       $4500

        $450 000 000

Germany

          31

       $1550

        $155 000 000

Finland

          30

       $1500

        $150 000 000

New Zealand

         21

       $1050

        $105 000 000

France

         20

      $1000

        $100 000 000

Australia

        10

      $500

        $50 000 000

UK

          7

      $350

        $35 000 000



1.  The average financial gain for above countries by using the ForestBucker will be at least $300 000 000 per year

2.  If your country is not listed above please contact us for estimating how much your country will benefit by using the ForestBucker

2.  Second Goal - What can the ForestBucker do for nature?

1.  Wood is such a magnificent commodity that it is impossible to stop people from chopping down trees. The need and greed for wood by humans are just too much

2.  We actively promote the use of plantation trees as an alternative for indigenous forest trees

"The best friend of earth of man is the tree. When we use the tree respectfully and economically, we have one of the greatest resources on earth" Frank Lloyd Wright 

3.  For every ten plantation trees harvested with the Forestbucker one plantation tree will be extra available to help save an indigenous forest tree

4.  By saving indigenous trees in a forest you also save the canopy that shelters and shades a kaleidoscope of shrubs and animals living in the forest

3.  Third Goal - What can the ForestBucker do for plantation trees?

Stop wasting wood resources of plantation trees by harvesting it if working with a low value product. Respect their bodies sacrificed for us. Listen what the forest whispers!

THE FOREST WHISPERS

My name is Fortis Arbor the Latin for a brave tree I am 29 years old.  If you count all members of my family Radiata Pine in my forest we will add up to 24307.  Today is a very emotional day for my family. We hear the approaching sound of roaring skidders, harvesters, de-limbers, process-heads with chainsaws, and other monstrous machines.  For 29 years we survive bitter cold winters, drought and nibbling possums.  We did nothing all these years but providing a canopy to shelter and shade a kaleidoscope of shrubs and beautiful birds singing about the excitement of life and we help saved the planet by absorbing carbon dioxide from the atmosphere.

We are well aware of the fact that we were planted, nurtured, pruned, protected against forest fires and saved by humans from the pineshoot borer, zimmermann beetle and a host of other horrifying insect pests.  We are ready to sacrifice our bodies to Homo sapiens.  Hark!  The forest whispers a last request before we are cut down.  It took us 29 years to build our bodies our last wish is that no wood will be wasted through imperfect bucking our stems into logs. As with people no two trees are the same. Every tree in the forest to be harvest has its own personal signature. Whoever knows how to read this signature can learn the truth about the tree.

Please spend the 60 seconds required by the ForestBucker 3D profile optimiser to determine the personal signature of every individual member of my family. Within these 60 seconds the ForestBucker takes 1700 measurements of the stem and makes 50 million calculations to get the personal perfect bucking solution of the stem of my family.

4.  Fourth Goal - What can the ForestBucker do for the Planet?

Help saving indigenous forests and minimize waste when harvesting plantation trees:

1.  The air we breathe is cleansed by the trees ability to remove carbon dioxide from the air and replenish oxygen in the atmosphere

2.  Forests give us high quality fresh water

3.  Minimises flooding by manages storm water effectively and prevent soil erosion

4.  Provides wildlife habitat and biodiversity it’s a living paradise

5.  Increases groundwater recharge

6.  Enrich the soil by recycling nutrients through the shedding of leaves and seeds

7.  The pollutant nitrogen dioxide is absorbed by the enzyme rich forest floor and released as harmless nitrogen

5.  Fifth Goal - What can the ForestBucker do for the Plantation Industry?

The ForestBucker can read the personal signature of every tree to:

1.  Add 10% to 20% value to the plantation trees

2.  Easily integrate with current harvesting operations

3.  Improved safety through remote control technology

4. For more technical information visit  www.forestbucker.com 

6.  Sixth Goal - What can the ForestBucker do for you?

By saving indigenous forest trees and minimise waste when harvesting plantation trees:

1.  Breathe clean air cleansed by trees

2.  Enjoy recreation in wild forests

3.  Hug-A-Tree for spiritual renewal and strengthening

4.  Many prescription drugs that you use contain active ingredients from forest trees

5.  The paper you write on the furniture you sit on the house you live in, they all came from trees. The uses of wood are virtually endless.The ForestBucker helps to make these products more affordable for you

I am the beam that holds your house, the board of your table;
I am the handle of your hoe,
the door of your homestead;
the wood of your cradle,
and the shell of your coffin.
I am the gift of God and
the friend of man."

story:
THANKS FOR YOUR SUPPORT!

Thanks to your generous donations, we raised $8912 in contributions from our IndieGoGo campaign. We're already using the money to support our organizing work in PA. None of this would be possible without your support.

There are several ways that you can stay updated on our EJS progress:

1) Join our Email List: bit.ly/EJS-email

2) Like our Facebook Page: facebook.com/energyjusticesummer

3) Follow our Blog: energyjusticesummer.org/blog

Finally, please let us know if you would like to visit us this summer! We would be happy to show you around Susquehanna County and connect you directly to residents organizing against gas extraction. Send Adam an email at adam@energyjusticesummer.org if you would like to arrange a visit.

Gratefully,

The Energy Justice Summer Organizing Committee

----------------------------------------------------------------

UPDATE: Successful $20,000 grant for EJS!

It's been an action-packed first four weeks of Energy Justice Summer. Since we moved in June 1, our young organizers have been hard at work working with impacted residents. CLICK HERE to read our EJS blog for updates!

We also heard really exciting news last week from Wallace Global Fund: we received a $20,000 grant for our organizing work! Along with the money we raised through your generous donations, we now have enough funding to provide stipends to our seven full-time youth organizers. 

With the grant secured, we now have a goal to raise $10,000 from this IndieGoGo campaign. We'll use the additional money to  build a  website that highlights the stories of residents impacted by fracking. We will then use the website to raise resources for court cases and clean water supplies.

Thank you so much for your generous contributions to this campaign! None of this would be possible without your support.

-The EJS Organizing Committee

EJS resident organizers Sarita, Allison, Collin, Spencer, Adam, and Maria

----------------------------------------------------------------

This summer, we're working in solidarity with communities on the frontlines of fracking.

We are young organizers who care deeply about social justice and human rights. We seek a world where everyone has access to sustainable energy and no one suffers unjustly because of our fossil fuel economy. We believe that fracking presents a grave threat to people everywhere, especially those on the frontlines of extraction. To create a just energy future, we must stop fracking.

This summer, SustainUS, Energy Justice Network and local community groups are launching a joint project called “Energy Justice Summer” to work in solidarity communities directly impacted by fracking in Pennsylvania. Here’s what we have planned:

  • COMMUNITY WORKSHOPS: We’ll host workshops with experts to teach residents how to monitor the environmental and socioeconomic impacts of fracking and organize to stop them.
  • STUDENT TRAININGS: We’ll convene students across the Northeast and prepare them to launch campaigns against fracking on campus this fall. 
  • IMPACTFUL RESEARCH: We’ll analyze violations of five gas companies, creating valuable materials for regulatory appeals and legal fights. We will show that rural poverty has increased since shale development has begun. Finally, we will report on the feasibility of a just transition away from fracking toward a green economy in Northeast Pennsylvania.
  • CREATIVE ACTIONS: We'll support ongoing fights to stop expansion of natural gas infrastructure, including the Cove Point LNG export terminal.
By contributing to our campaign, you will help to stop fracking and bring about a more just energy future. From the frontlines of fracking in Pennsylvania to the devastation of Typhoon Haiyan in the Philippines, people are suffering because of continued fossil fuel extraction. We need to show that fracking is unacceptable and that young people will stand in solidarity with the communities most impacted. We need Energy Justice Summer.

How we'll use the money we raise:

To make Energy Justice Summer possible, we need to raise $25,000. This will cover housing, food, transportation, printing costs and other materials, and summer stipends for eight organizing fellows. Our goal from this crowdfunding campaign is to raise $15,000, which will guarantee the house rental, communal food, transportation costs, and $5000 in need-based stipends. If we raise more money than our goal, we will be able to expand our the stipends we offer to fellows and increase our impact this summer.

Here's specifically how we will use the money we raise from crowdfunding:

  • House rental for the summer: $1000/month * 3 months = $3000
  • Communal food: $250/person/month * 2.5 months * 8 people = $5000
  • Transportation costs (for organizing-related driving): 50 mi/day/car        * 2 cars * 75 days / 15 miles/gallon *$4.00/gallon = $2000
  • Need-based stipends for organizing fellows: $5,000

TOTAL: $15,000

We are soliciting grants from foundations to cover the remaining for the costs of running Energy Justice Summer. If we don't reach our fundraising goal, we will still run the program but will reduce the number of fellows. Regardless of how much we raise, we are are committed to securing the house and working with communities impacted by fracking in Pennsylvania.

Fracking endangers our air, water, climate, health, and traditional rural heritage economies.

Pollution from fracking is a direct threat to our air, water, climate, and health. Fracking endangers air quality through the high release of contaminants from equipment and intentional venting during the transport. Fracking is associated with groundwater contamination, including methane and heavy metals. In 2013, the state of Pennsylvania alone received 398 complaints of water contamination from drilling. Finally, methane leaks associated with fracking can make the climate impacts of the process even worse than coal.

Ways YOU can help spread the word:

Right now, we need people to help share our campaign personally. Whether by phone, text, email, or face to face, telling your friends about our campaign and encouraging them to contribute will really help. We are also planning to go BIG with social media on Monday May 12. We'll send out more about that soon!

Thanks for your support. Together, we can stop fracking and bring about a more just energy future. This is the summer we will push for #EnergyJustice.

PERKS for contributing to our campaign:

We hope that you will contribute to our campaign out of the goodness of your heart and a desire to help the communities most impacted by fracking in Pennsylvania. But to further motivate you, we created some exciting perks:

  • A digital"thank you" video message from our team in beautiful Susquehanna County Pennsylvania, where we'll be this summer.

  • Triple Divide movie: Called the "best documentary on fracking" to date, this film is narrated by academy-award winner Mark Ruffalo and features the stories of some residents we will be work with this summer. See: www.tripledividefilm.org

  • Gasland and Gasland 2 movies: Josh Fox's documentaries helped to make fracking a national issue. These groundbreaking films feature many of the Pennsylvania community leaders we will work with this summer. See: www.gaslandthemovie.com

  • One bag of "Fracktivist" blend from Gimme Coffee: 

    According to the company, "We need clean water to have great coffee, thriving farms, and healthy people. That's why a portion of proceeds from every bag of Fracktivist Blend supports the anti-fracking movement." Great coffee while fighting fracking. What's not to like?

  • ENERGY Coffeetable Book: A beautiful coffee-table book with many horrifying images of fracking and other fossil fuel extraction sites. But don't worry; it also contains hopeful images of renewables! 

  • Dinner on the Delaware River: Come out to Pennsylvania and let our team treat you to dinner at a top tier restaurant on the Delaware River (which incidentally currently has a moratorium on fracking!)

  • Bed and Breakfast weekend in Northeast PA: Bring your partner or friend and spend a weekend relaxing at one of the finest Bed & Breakfasts in Northeastern PA. Our team member from Pike County is an expert in local attractions and will help you plan your weekend. Preview your weekend at www.discoverpikepa.com.

  • Weeklong Vacation in the Poconos: We'll set you and your sweetheart or friend up for a week in the Poconos! Our team member from Pike County is an expert in local attractions and will personally help you create your dream vacation. Preview your getaway at www.discoverpikepa.com.
