Students at the Arava Institute are comprised of Jordanians, Palestinians, Israelis, and others from all over the world.


NGO: The Peres Center for Peace

Watch as the Peres Center for Peace, together with the Palestinian Wildlife Society and the Rabayah Group at the Partnership for Peace project funded by the EU work together to bring renewable energy to underserved Palestinian communities.














Waste capacity: The system can process up to 6 liters a day of food waste or 15 liters a day of animal manure.
Output: Depending on the amount of waste, can go up to three hours of cooking and 5 to 10 liters of liquid fertilizer per day. 
Minimum Ambient  Average Day/Night Temperature (necessary for operation): 17°C (66F).
Nominal gas pressure: 15 milliBar.
Built-in filter: Removes H2S. 
Built in fertilizer chlorinator.
Weight: less than 40 kg (88lbs). 
Dimensions: 123H/165L/100W cm (48”x65”x39.4”).












Operation:

Q: Do I need electricity to operate Hombiogas?
A: No. The system is 100% off-grid.
Q: How long after putting organic waste into HomeBiogas will it produce gas?
A: After installation, HomeBiogas may take between 2-4 weeks to produce gas.
Q: Is biogas production continuous?
A: Yes. As long as you feed the system, it will continue to produce gas.
Q: What happens if I don’t feed the system for a while?
A: The system will digest all the waste inside the tank then stop producing gas.
Once you get back to feeding the system it will return to continuous biogas production.

Installation:

Q: How long does it take to install HomeBiogas?
A: It takes two people about 2 hours to install HomeBiogas.
Q: Can I install the system by myself?
A: Yes. Anyone can assemble the biogas unit. However, connecting HomeBiogas’s gas pipe to the stove should be done by a licensed gas technician. Detailed instructions are provided with the system.
Q: How much water do I fill HomeBiogas with?
A: Initially, fill the tank with water to its full capacity(about 650 liter). Once HomeBiogas is in operation, remember to add one liter of water for every liter of waste added.
Q: How do I activate HomeBiogas?
A: You can activate HomeBiogas one of two ways. The most effective method is to use animal manure (specifically any animal that chews its cud i.e. a cow). If you don’t have access to animal manure, biogas bacteria starter kits can easily be acquired. Detailed instructions are provided with the system.

Performance:

Q: How much waste can I feed HomeBiogas each day?
A: You can input up to 6 liters (6qt) of food waste or up to 15 liters (15qt) of animal manure into HomeBiogas each day. If you feed the system with less, the amount of gas produced will be smaller.
Q: How much gas can I produce with HomeBiogas?
A: Every liter of food waste produces about 200 liters of gas, the amount needed to cooking for one hour over a high flame. On average, HomeBiogas produces 2-3 hours of cooking gas each day - the perfect amount for three meals.
Q: For how long does a gas burner and barbecue grill run on a full HomeBiogas tank? 
A: A full HomeBiogas tank (400 liters of biogas) can fuel a three-blade barbecue grill for 45 minutes, and a typical stove burner for about two hours.
Q: How many liters of fertilizer can I get from HomeBiogas each day? 
A: HomeBiogas can provide between 5-10 liters of top quality natural fertilizer each day.

Maintenance:

Q: What type of maintenance is involved with HomeBiogas?
A: We recommend maintaining your HomeBiogas unit once a year by:
 1. Replacing its gas filter (takes a minute to do and filter cost about $20).
 2. Removing the sludge that accumulates at the bottom of the digestion tank via the outlet pipe.

Safety & Warranty:

Q: Is HomeBiogas safe?
A: Yes. HomeBioGas was tested and received the European Community CE stamp of approval for safety. We are starting the process of getting UL approval. HomeBiogas was also tested and approved for safety and health by the Israeli Ministry of Environmental Protection and Ministry Of Energy and Infrastructure.
Q: Does HomeBiogas come with a warranty?
A: Yes. HomeBiogas comes with a 12 month limited parts and materials warranty.

Additional Info:

We highly recommend connecting HomeBiogas to a separate burner placed on your counter-top (bought separately), so it is simple to use Biogas and/or your existing gas system.
Q: Will it work in any weather?
A: HomeBiogas performs well when the day/night 24-hour average temperature is 17°C (63°F) and above. Once the temperature drops lower than that the unit’s gas output is significantly reduced. On the other hand the system will work very effectively in high temperatures, either humid or arid.
Q: What about cold countries?
A: We are developing a cold weather solution. Since we do not provide the solution as of yet, we can't recommend installing the system in cold weather countries. To get notified once the solution will be available follow us on facebook. 
Q: Can I connect HomeBiogas to the existing appliances in my house?
A: Yes, but your home appliance, including your stove, need to be modified to support biogas. A single burner cannot be shared and used both for biogas and conventional gas.
Q: How do I convert my stove into a biogas stove? 
A: You have to take out the pressure reducing nozzle (contact us for more details).
Q: Can I purchase the biogas stove from you?
A: No. You’ll need to purchase the stove locally.
Q: Can I use HomeBiogas for water heating?
A: Yes, but since the amount of gas produced will be sufficient for a maximum of 45 minutes of heating or less, we recommend using the gas for cooking and the fertilizer for the garden. This way you can complete a natural food cycle in your own home.
Q: Can I install HomeBiogas indoors?
A: We recommend  the installation of HomeBiogas outdoors because once the gas tank is in its full capacity (400L) any excess gas generated  will be released to the atmosphere.
Q: Can I fill HomeBiogas with grey water?
A: Yes. The system is grey water compatible.
Q:  I have a composter, what is the added benefit of biogas?
A: Composters are mostly suitable to process lawn cuttings, leaves, grass wood shavings and vegetarian matter. For many reasons, composters are not truly suitable for kitchen leftovers like meat, fish, oil and fats. HomeBiogas is complementary to the composter since it digests the remains that the composter cannot process, and it also provides cooking gas and liquid fertilizer for immediate use.
Q: What happens to the excess gas I don’t use?
A: The built in tank stores 400 liters of gas. Any additional gas generated by the system is automatically released and dissipates into the atmosphere.
Q: Can I store gas for a later use?
A: Theoretically yes, but we do not provide a solution for accumulating gas for later use. Our system aims for direct use of the gas generated by your daily waste. 


Performance


Gas production depends on the waste content that is being fed in, and might be less than expected.

Climate/weather



Our system can operate in warm and hot regions. If in any given month, the average day/night (24 hour) temperature drops below 18 degrees Centigrade (66 degrees Fahrenheit), the biological activity drops significantly and gas production will decrease.


Once it is full with water, exposure to temperatures below freezing point can cause damage to the system



Product related



Do not drink the fertilizer – plants love it, but it is not fit for humans.


The unit needs to be installed in an open space or a well ventilated enclosure and may not be installed indoors.

story:
Short Summary

Schools and sustainability seems like an obvious partnership, but bringing the two together is often harder than it needs to be. Many schools are without a green or sustainability team because they simply lack the volunteer power to get it started and keep it going. To bridge this gap, Create Plenty is piloting a four step approach of Education, Collection, Creation and measurable Outcomes (ECCO) to improve academic achievement through environmental action that leads to measurable results. While helping steer schools toward resources to maintain a green team with volunteer support, we will also save schools money, create a way for students who want to become agents of change for their planet, and build leadership skills.

We’re using crowd-funding not only to raise money, but to demonstrate widespread popular support for schools going green. Contribute to our campaign, and bring attention to the fact that every K-12 school in the 21st century needs to help educate its children on how to address the ecological challenges students will face in their lifetimes. Reducing plastic pollution generated in schools will be a first step, and the rest will follow. 

What We Need & What You Get

We are seeking $2,500 funding for the next stage of our International Plastic Quilt ECCO Project for the development of our program. The Johnson Ohana Foundation will be matching donations received by November 1st, 2013.

This project will produce the academic achievement and plastic pollution reduction data we need to quantify our impact on reducing plastic pollution and increasing student achievement during school.

Perks!:

$25 - upcycled plastic lid garden art on a stick (googly-eyed ladybug or monster)

$100 - all the above plus a reusable bag and homemade cookies

$250 - all the above plus choose from artwork available for sale on our website.


The Impact

The ECCO project will impact in two ways:

·Environmentally, it will show an immediate reduction in the amount of plastic entering the waste stream, and

·Academically, it will support student's problem solving and critical thinking.  Setting goals, organization, collaboration, and measuring results.

The current barrier to student's success we face is one that became apparent as a result of our past success - many students who participated in IPQP are motivated to take further steps to reduce their school’s output of plastic waste.  Students need training, mentoring and support materials to develop skills and self-confidence in areas such as critical thinking and problem solving skills, working in teams and community outreach. 

Other Ways You Can Help

We're also interested in volunteers! http://www.createplenty.org/volunteer/

story:
About the Book

Lone Mountain is the first-ever children’s book about the national tragedy of mountaintop removal mining. Set in central Appalachia, Lone Mountain tells the story of a mountain, its people, and what happens when mountain top removal threatens to destroy the balance of nature. Lush with beautiful illustrations of native plants and animals, this book focuses on the unique, renewable resources offered by the Appalachian mountains. And how anyone- big or small- can have an impact when it comes to saving the land they love.

The campaign to end the ecological crisis that is mountaintop removal has a more than 30-year history, and yet few resources exist for children to learn about this important topic. All of us on the Lone Mountain team feel that it is imperative for our children to learn about the great gifts of Appalachian ecosystems so that they understand the impact of destruction wrought by this mining. You can make this book a reality, and get your own copy in the process!

Contributions will go directly to getting Lone Mountain printed (the largest cost in our project), paying for shipping (you get a book!), and lastly, paying us for our efforts (we get to eat!) We've done the writing, the illustration, the research and planning- now all we need are your funds to make this book into a reality!

Book Details

  • Dimensions: Softcover, 12" x 8.5", 32 pages long, with full color illustrations
  • Structure: There is a main story and an instructional back section on terms and concepts for young readers.
  • Reading Level: 8-10 years old, but the book can (and should!) be read to younger children.                                        
  • Printers: Our printers are an independent southern business- Electric City Printers, and the books will be printed on FSC-Certified Paper.
The Ordering System

This campaign isn't just a way to contribute to a great cause- it's also a way for others to contribute to YOUR cause! We have priced our books at a low base price, so that other organizations focused on Appalachia's future can resell the book at a decent profit to themselves. Please see our ordering system below!

One book order is $15. For orders of 2 or more books, the price is reduced to $8.

  • Five books can be ordered at a discounted $40 Donation (see the $40 Perk)
  • Ten books can be ordered at a discounted $80 Donation (see the $80 Perk)
To order any other number of books, big or small, click on the $15 Reward Perk and add $8 for every additional book you want. At the end of the campaign we'll double-check with you before sending the order. You will also receive rewards from the Perk that closest matches the amount of money in your order.

Other basic prices

With $15 cost for the first book, and $8 after:

  • 2 Books: $23
  • 15 Books: $127
  • 20 Books: $167
  • 25 Books: $207
  • 30 Books: $247

Don't want books in bulk? That's fine, because we are offering a lot of exciting rewards for different donation Perks, including individual copies of the Lone Mountain book, prints, postcards, pottery and more! Check out the Perks on the right-hand side of this page. Some of our rewards include...

Handmade vases from Sarah Sunshine Pottery, Black Mountain, NC

Si Kahn's CD "Courage," which was named the #1 CD for 2010 by the Folk Alliance. Read more about the CD here.


A print of the morning forest scene from the book.


The Impact

Lone Mountain will take its place among other inspiring books created to educate children about environmental protection. Award-winning books like The Great Kapok Tree and A River Ran Wild (both by Lynne Cherry) served as models when we were creating this project. With this book, children across the nation will learn about the valuable resources Appalachia offers and how to take action against the impacts of mountaintop removal mining.

Praise for Lone Mountain

"A parable for the possible, Lone Mountain is a timely and important story for kids, their families and schools, about the challenges in protecting our natural homelands. The beautiful illustrations and moving story will inspire readers to climb their own mountains- and take a stand." - Jeff Biggers, Author of "The United States of Appalachia."

"This book is a must-have for all elementary school science and social studies classes, whether they are located in the coal fields or in the high-rise canyons of big cities." -Sue Massek, Activist, Musician and Educator, member of the Reel World String Band

"This thoughtful and beautifully illustrated children's story book is another important educational tool in the ongoing effort to stop mountaintop removal. Buy it, recommend it, and share it with people of all ages." -Stephen L. Fisher, editor of "Fighting Back in Appalachia" and co-editor of "Transforming Places: Lessons from Appalachia."

"In this children's book for all of us, Saro Lynch-Thomason holds out a vision of what a renewed, vibrant Appalachia can be, soon and for all time- and tells us in no uncertain words that future is, in the deepest sense, in our hands." -Si Kahn, Appalachian organizer, author and musician

"Lone Mountain hits close to home and exemplifies the true cost of coal in Appalachia. My children will not know the beauty of the forest and the mountain above the home I was raised on. This book is a testament to the connections with nature our children desperately need, and the will to preserve it." -Nick Mullins, 4th Generation Underground Coal Miner

Look at more reviews here.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please don't hesitate to spread the word for us!

Share this page on Facebook and Twitter, and proudly post about your donation to our cause!
You can also:
  • Share your enthusiasm for this project on our Facebook Page- like and share us!
  • Learn more about the project at our website: www.lonemountainbook.com

Project Partners

Over a dozen regional and national organizations have already contributed to our campaign, including the Center for Biological Diversity, The Tennessee Clean Water Network (our fiscal sponsor), Mountain Justice, the Western North Carolina Alliance, Black Warrior River Keeper and the Alliance for Appalachia. See all of them here or click on the image below.


                       


The Main Team


Saro Lynch-Thomason-  artist and story writer, fundraising

Saro Lynch-Thomason is the artist, story writer, project coordinator and lesson plan developer for the project. She began the Lone Mountain Book Project as an intern in 2008 with non-profit United Mountain Defense. She is an illustrator, Appalachian ballad singer and amateur folklorist.

Read more here.



Bonnie Swinford - project co-coordinator, fundraising, marketing and research

Bonnie Swinford is a lover of nature and science who has worked at environmental education centers across the southeast sharing her passion for the natural world with children. When she became the director of a Montessori middle school she had a group of students who were concerned about mountaintop removal coal mining. In an effort to help her students learn more, Bonnie discovered a deep love for the mountains and people of Appalachia. She has spent the last 6 years organizing students and youth to work for environmental justice, by developing solidarity-based relationships between young people and communities directly-impacted by mountaintop removal. Bonnie is a nonprofit consultant who works with grassroots environmental justice organizations.



Erin Bicknese - research, fundraising, lesson plan development

Erin Bicknese began her work in the anti-strip mining movement while living in Northern Wisconsin, and moved back to her home state of Tennessee after learning about mountaintop removal. Since then, she has worked with a number of groups that seek to end MTR and support a healthy Appalachia. Her life has been strongly shaped by time spent with children, as well as with good children's books. While studying social justice at Northland College, she had the pleasure of reviewing children's environmental literature through the SONWA Nature Writing Awards. These days, Erin's life is filled with her two passions: being an artisan bread baker and a birth doula.

Read about other team members on our website here.

story:
A life-affirming music, art, and media project to raise awareness for Generation Waking Up!

In support of

Amazon Watch, Pachamama Alliance,

and introducing 

The Yawanawa Project

( ( ( ❤ ) ) ) 

 

I.AM.LIFE is a multi-media campaign for radical interconnectivity and participation. Highlighting the connection of Western youth with Amazonia and its indigenous people, the campaign will creatively express the urgency and possibility of taking personal responsibility for life and empower youth to do so.

With your help we'd like to empower and send 12 Youth to the Esalen Institute in Big Sur, CA for the I.AM.LIFE/GenUp Summit and 6 to the Amazon as part of our efforts to inspire, educate, and create new leaders! 

 

The core creative component of the campaign will be original I.AM.LIFE artworks created by world-class and up & coming visionary artists:  

Android Jones . Geo Glyphiks . Daniel Mirante . Jessica Perstein . Chris Marcinkowski

Olivia Curry . Justin Totemical . Mark Lee . Sunny Solwind . Radhika Hersey

Mugwort Artemisia . Abhi Thati . Melissa Williams . Jesse Noemind . Being IsOne

Carlito Dalceggio... more TBA.

These original I.AM.LIFE works will be auctioned in the spring to raise funds and awareness for the work of the organizations involved and be the centerpiece of an I.AM.LIFE campaign in Spring 2013.

 

1. November 10th Kick-Off event, Los Angeles! 

Day: “The Generation Wake Up Experience!” - an interactive, multimedia, peer-led workshop that moves participants into lasting hope and inspired action toward a thriving, just, sustainable world.  

Evening: *Live Media Creation: LA spoken-word artists showcase, visionary art, awesome food/drink, and collaborative music performances by:

Avari . LuvAmp Project . Miranda Rondeau . Mikey Pauker & The Joy Machine . Earth Wake . DJ Drez . The BOLT . Drew Dellinger . Mike ThePoet . Tiger Moon . Rich Ferguson & more.

2. I.AM.LIFE/GenUp Youth Summit @ Esalen Institute, Big Sur, CA:

Feb. 1st - 3rd, 2013 - a selected group of participants will be invited to attend and help shape the I.AM.LIFE campaign and receive the LA ‘GenUp’ Leadership Training to delve into the questions raised during the “WakeUp Experience” and learn to facilitate one. 

3. Art 4 LIFE Gala:

March 2013 - Premier of the original I.AM.LIFE artworks.

4. I.AM.LIFE Media campaign:

Bringing together original spoken word, music, and visionary art creations. 

5. Trip to Amazonia!: 

That's right! A small group of approx. 6 participants from the GenUp training and I.AM.LIFE Summint at Esalen will be invited to travel to the Amazon and meet the Yawanawa people to learn, to grow, and develop an going reciprocal relationship with them and support their traditional medicinal plant garden project. 

Flower of Life collection:

      

 

I.AM.LIFE Tee

 

 

 

 

I.AM.LIFE Sprout Farm

   

The sprouting kit includes:: 

  • one jar
  • one bike inner tube rubber band
  • 3 screens
  • angle block
  • instructions 

 

The ORG (Organic Rainforest Goods) collection:

Cofán or Awajún Unisex Bracelet $25+

 

Awajún Beaded Necklace $50+

 

 

Cofán Beaded Necklace $75

 

 

The Honey Bee:

 

 

 

*Live Media Creation: The core content of the I.AM.LIFE campaign will be created at the Nov. 10th Kick Off event. The room will be abuzz with professional photographers and film crews to capture images, spoken-word and music performances. All attending will be invited to contribute. Selected images will be given to participating visionary artists to create original “I.AM.LIFE” artworks to be presented and auctioned at the ART 4 LIFE Gala Event, Nov. 2nd, 2013. Video content will be become original I.AM.LIFE video shorts in support of the campaign.

 

 

Generation Waking Up! http://generationwakingup.org/

Amazon Watch http://amazonwatch.org/

Pachamama Alliance http://www.pachamama.org/

Yawanawa Project http://www.yawanawa-project.org/

The LuvAmp project http://luvamp.org/i-am-life

A life-affirming music, art, and media project to raise awareness for Generation Waking Up!

In support of
Amazon Watch, Pachamama Alliance,
and introducing 
The Yawanawa Project
( ( ( ❤ ) ) ) 

 

I.AM.LIFE is a multi-media campaign for radical interconnectivity and participation. Highlighting the connection of Western youth with Amazonia and its indigenous people, the campaign will creatively express the urgency and possibility of taking personal responsibility for life and empower youth to do so.
With your help we'd like to empower and send 12 Youth to the Esalen Institute in Big Sur, CA for the I.AM.LIFE/GenUp Summit and 6 to the Amazon as part of our efforts to inspire, educate, and create new leaders! 
 

The core creative component of the campaign will be original I.AM.LIFE artworks created by world-class and up & coming visionary artists:  
Android Jones . Geo Glyphiks . Daniel Mirante . Jessica Perstein . Chris Marcinkowski
Olivia Curry . Justin Totemical . Mark Lee . Sunny Solwind . Radhika Hersey
Mugwort Artemisia . Abhi Thati . Melissa Williams . Jesse Noemind . Being IsOne
Carlito Dalceggio... more TBA.
These original I.AM.LIFE works will be auctioned in the spring to raise funds and awareness for the work of the organizations involved and be the centerpiece of an I.AM.LIFE campaign in Spring 2013.
 

1. November 10th Kick-Off event, Los Angeles! 
Day: “The Generation Wake Up Experience!” - an interactive, multimedia, peer-led workshop that moves participants into lasting hope and inspired action toward a thriving, just, sustainable world.  Evening: *Live Media Creation: LA spoken-word artists showcase, visionary art, awesome food/drink, and collaborative music performances by:Avari . LuvAmp Project . Miranda Rondeau . Mikey Pauker & The Joy Machine . Earth Wake . DJ Drez . The BOLT . Drew Dellinger . Mike ThePoet . Tiger Moon . Rich Ferguson & more.
2. I.AM.LIFE/GenUp Youth Summit @ Esalen Institute, Big Sur, CA:
Feb. 1st - 3rd, 2013 - a selected group of participants will be invited to attend and help shape the I.AM.LIFE campaign and receive the LA ‘GenUp’ Leadership Training to delve into the questions raised during the “WakeUp Experience” and learn to facilitate one. 
3. Art 4 LIFE Gala: 
March 2013 - Premier of the original I.AM.LIFE artworks.
4. I.AM.LIFE Media campaign:
Bringing together original spoken word, music, and visionary art creations. 

5. Trip to Amazonia!: 
That's right! A small group of approx. 6 participants from the GenUp training and I.AM.LIFE Summint at Esalen will be invited to travel to the Amazon and meet the Yawanawa people to learn, to grow, and develop an going reciprocal relationship with them and support their traditional medicinal plant garden project. 
Flower of Life collection:
      
 
I.AM.LIFE Tee
 
 

 
 
I.AM.LIFE Sprout Farm
   
The sprouting kit includes:: 

one jar
one bike inner tube rubber band
3 screens
angle block
instructions 
 
The ORG (Organic Rainforest Goods) collection:
Cofán or Awajún Unisex Bracelet $25+
 
Awajún Beaded Necklace $50+
 
 
Cofán Beaded Necklace $75
 
 
The Honey Bee:
 

 
 
*Live Media Creation: The core content of the I.AM.LIFE campaign will be created at the Nov. 10th Kick Off event. The room will be abuzz with professional photographers and film crews to capture images, spoken-word and music performances. All attending will be invited to contribute. Selected images will be given to participating visionary artists to create original “I.AM.LIFE” artworks to be presented and auctioned at the ART 4 LIFE Gala Event, Nov. 2nd, 2013. Video content will be become original I.AM.LIFE video shorts in support of the campaign.
 
 
Generation Waking Up! http://generationwakingup.org/
Amazon Watch http://amazonwatch.org/
Pachamama Alliance http://www.pachamama.org/
Yawanawa Project http://www.yawanawa-project.org/
The LuvAmp project http://luvamp.org/i-am-life

story:
Who are we?

City Charter High School is a small, diverse public school in the heart of downtown Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania. For the last three years, students of all grade levels and abilities have successfully implemented a school-wide, non-profit recycling business, SEED Students Encouraging Environmentalism Downtown. Through the international organization SAGE, Students for the Advancement of Global Entrepreneurship, our business has grown and inspired myself and dozes of my classmates to take an active role in lessening our school's and city's environmental impact. Some of SEED's accomplishments and outreach efforts over the past three years include...
  • The collection of over 90 tons of recyclable paper products
  • The collection of over 60 tons of additional recyclable material (plastic, metal, glass)
  • The safe removal of electronics such as computer equipment, batteries, and cell phones
  • Donations to Tree Pittsburgh, an organization that restores and protects our city's trees
  • Donations to Heifer International, a global organization that provides honey bees, livestock, and seedlings to struggling areas on each continent
  • Donations to the Bethlehem Haven Women's Shelter
  • Volunteer work with urban greenspaces
  • Distribution of yearly SAGE and SEED scholarships to hard working seniors
In 2012, SEED competed at the National SAGE Competition in San Francisco, California. We presented our then new business and were thrilled to receive second place. In 2013, we again competed nationally in Cincinnati, Ohio. After expanding our business and becoming more involved in the community, we succeeded in winning first place. This year, in 2014, we competed for a third time in our home city of Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania. We were again victorious, winning our second back to back national title! 
The next step for our business is to compete at this year's SAGE Global Competition in Moscow, Russia. As the President of the City High branch of SAGE, I have witnessed the profound impact environmentally focused entrepreneurship can have on my city and my classmates and friends. 
It's time for City Charter High School to achieve its global potential. 

What We Need 

As a non-profit business, we at SEED use our earnings for continuous community outreach efforts, scholarships, and charitable donations. To attend the SAGE Global Competition, we are in need of community support. Our environmental focus allows us to be a part of not only the Pittsburgh community but the global community as well. Here's where you come in. 

In an effort to bring our vision of environmental entrepreneurship to the world stage, we are in need of donations. Any financial support you are willing to give will help us to pay for visas and air fare to Moscow and general travel expenses only. We intend to remain a true non-profit organization while still taking advantage of this amazing opportunity to network with students from across the globe. 

    The Impact

    Just as I have witnessed our business impact the lives of my classmates, I know that the opportunity to compete at this year's SAGE Global Competition will impact the lives of our dedicated, hard working team. We have rehearsed our presentation countless hours and invested our time into the improvement of SEED. The opportunity to travel and share our story will provide the kind of leverage necessary to further expand our entrepreneurial efforts. 

    We are extremely proud of our small school business but understand that this is only the beginning. By competing in Moscow, we will be able to spread our message to other high schools. We hope to inspire other young people to take up action and improve the environment they live in, the environment we all live in. 

      Risks & Challenges

      It is unrealistic to believe that our entire travel expenses can be payed for through online donations. We are seeking, instead, to use crowd sourcing to cover $5000 worth of travel costs. We also understand that SEED is still only one small business in one small high school. But we are sure that with your help, one day, SEED will no longer be a seed; it will be a forest, and we all know our world could use a few more trees. 

        Other Ways You Can Help

        If you are unable to assist financially, you can help City High's SEED business by liking our page on Facebook, following our Instagram and Twitter accounts, and checking out our recent video project here.

story:
OUR GOAL:

To reduce single-use plastic waste in the United States by ten percent in ten years.

By creating high quality, eco-friendly alternatives to single-use plastic items such as plastic straws, bags and water bottles.

OUR VISION:

To build a manufacturing plant in our hometown of Reading, PA and pay our employees thriving wages.

We want the best paper straws in the world to be made in Reading, Pennsylvania.

 

 

 

IMPACT

 

Environmental Impact

Scientists estimate that there are 7.5 million plastic straws polluting U.S. shorelines and that up to eight million metric tons of plastic enter the world’s oceans every year

 

There will be more plastic than fish in the oceans by the year 2050.

 

 

90% of seabirds have ingested plastic

 

 

It is time to make a difference.

By switching to paper straws, we can help to reduce these startling statistics!

 

Social Impact

Reading, Pennsylvania NEEDS jobs!

The famous Philadelphia & Reading Railroad Company was one of the largest corporations in America in the 1870's. Reading was a thriving hub of commerce and manufacturing until the Reading Railroad went bankrupt in 1971.  With the closing of the Reading Railroad, the city as a whole began to decline quickly. The inhabitants of Reading became deprived of a major means of transportation to access commutable jobs in neighboring cities. During Reading’s peak in the 1930's, more than 110,000 people lived there. In the following decades, Reading lost nearly half its population as factories moved away and the demand for coal subsided. Countless jobs were lost due to the closing and relocation of businesses and factories.

Without jobs, the crime, unemployment and poverty rate has increased exponentially.

In 2012, The New York Times deemed Reading, Pennsylvania

 "the nation's poorest city."

In 2018, 39.3% of the Reading population live below the poverty line

(the national average is 14%!)

 

City of Reading, PA Average Household Income

 

National Average Household Income

 

PLEDGE BREAKDOWN

 

PERKS

 

 

 

 

 

MEET THE FOUNDERS OF WORLD BRAND

World Brand™ was founded in 2018 by Shanna Henry and Petros Pappalas, both Reading, Pennsylvania natives. Bearing witness to the devastation and impact that plastic pollution is wreaking on the planet, we conceived the idea to create a dye-free, biodegradable paper straw that is not only great for the environment, but is a superior upgrade to the current paper straws on the market in terms of both aesthetic and function. Being raised in Reading, PA, we share a sense of pride in the history of our hometown and are inspired and devoted to helping restore Reading's longstanding foundation of manufacturing.  

Risks & Challenges

The vast majority of paper straws on the market today are manufactured in China, which is where we currently source our paper straws.  Bringing manufacturing from Asia to the U.S. to efficiently produce our straws stateside will be a gradual process.  Our commitment to quality, price competitiveness and thriving wages for our employees will be our guiding force as we continue to improve and grow.

 

This crowdfunding campaign is part of The Great Social Enterprise Pitch, a friendly competition facilitated by ASSETS and the Lancaster County Community Foundation. The Pitch consists of social enterprise ideas based in Central Pennsylvania. A Social Enterprise is a market-based, income-generating enterprise that aims to solve a social and/or environmental problem through its business activities. Social enterprises focus on a triple bottom line:  people, planet, and profit. Upon completion of the Crowdfunding phase of the competition, 5 ideas will be chosen to move on to the Live Pitch, during which the contestants will present their ideas to a panel of judges, with winners receiving a package of cash and pro-bono prizes. In 2017, winners received over $50,000 in cash and pro-bono prizes. In addition, all participants have agreed to donate 5% of their total raised funds from their crowdfunding campaign to ASSETS.

 

Please visit www.lancasterpitch.com for more information.

 

To access to the crowdfunding sites of all participating social enterprise ideas, click here: https://www.indiegogo.com/partners/SocialEnterp....

story:
Short Summary

Hey there!

Thanks for the visit!

My names Angelica Snowden. I''ve grown up in Canberra, Australia. At the moment, I still live in Canberra, studying for a Bachelor of Science at the Australian National University.

I hope to graduate at the end of 2013. In the meantime, university has presented many academic, social, sporting, even political opportunities. Having access to these oppurtunities has been inspiring and encouraged me pursue volunteering, something I have wanted to do and experience for a while.

Recently, I succesfully applied to work with the International Student Volunteer (ISV) organisation in San Jose, Costa Rica! The program is 5 weeks all up, with 1 week of spanish, cooking and salsa lessons, 2 weeks of volunteer work and 2 weeks of adventure touring. Hopefully, with your help, I will be working with the conservation/wild life projects and experiencing the country's amazing sustainable development program!   

What We Need & What You Get

I have set a goal of raising $2, 000 to cover almost half the program price, which is $4, 495 in total.  However, I'm setting my sights high and aiming to raise enough money to match the cost of the program! I'm hoping to achieve this through indiegogo as well as through many different fundraising channels. Will keep you posted on my fund raising venture!

Donating a little will  absolutely take me a really long way! Should you decide to leave a donation, it will go towards my accomodation, meals, necessary gear and general program costs. Ultimately, this fundraising is helping me work with native species and willdlife in San Jose. I'll be set to gain a valuable, life changing experience with the Costa Rican sustainable development program and of course, in many, many more ways.  

While every donation recieved will be greatly appreciated, there are some perks for high bidders!! I've only set one perk, at a $50 (or greater) donation. Donors of this amount will be awarded with ... ***drum roll please!***

A personal invitation (from me! in person, or via youtube, facebook, twitter, mail, plane writing in the sky.. you name it!) to a one night only event, Ladies & Gentlemen ... A SNOWDEN BASH (Renowned, yet rare these days) To be henceforth titled, 'Angelica's Destination: Costa Rica!' party! 

But seriously, I couldn't think of a better way to share my experiences, photos, laughs, war stories, EVERYTHING with you and the rest of my friends & family, then hosting everyone to a party and celebrating together! I'll provide drinks, music, a taste of Central and South America and of course, the company!    

...and yes, while it will be a Latino flavoured party, dress for a jungle themed twist of the tropical Costa Rican kind, amigas!! ;D

The Impact

Supporting me, means supporting ISV's initiative in Costa Rica. You will encourage the organisation's long standing effort to develop grass roots and a long term foundation for sustainable projects in wildlife and habitat conservation. If you're interested in finding out more infomation on my project, or the organisation I would encourage you to check out this link!

http://www.isvolunteers.org/destination/costa-rica (there's also lots of infomation if you're interested in volunteering yourself!)

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute (I'm a university student, you're preaching to the choir!), but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

I would encourage anyone who has access to my fundraiser to help me make some noise about it! Feel free to share on social networking sites, email even word of mouth (prehistoric methods are celebrated & highly respected!! haha)  

Thank you for your time and generosity, it is very much appreciated and I look forward to sharing my adventures with you! What's more, watch this space  for info on a travel blog I'll keep so I can share pics, vids and stories while I'm overseas !!

story:
Help us Expand Mistletoe Ranch.

Dave and Shannon have built an off grid home in the pine and oak forest that is adjacent to the Gila National Forest. The small home, nestled on 11 acres, is a model for low impact and environmentally responsible living. Dave and Shannon live on Mistletoe Ranch with their beloved husky mix mutt rescue dog, Cuba.

Plant Based Business: We can harvest and sell Mistletoe for the health and wellbeing industry and for ceremonial and religious use. Most of our sales are in winter time. We have an abundance of high grade mistletoe that grows on the oak trees in our forest. Every year more and more grows. We want to purchase the 15 acre parcel next to us to help expand our available harvest and to increase the amount of land under sound environmental stewardship.

If you help us with a contribution, we can ensure that we have the sustainable resources to keep this land safe from development and sprawl. The plant based business that is Mistletoe Ranch can continue for years to come.

Help us Buy and Protect 15 More Acres

We need help securing money to purchase the 15 acres of land next to us. We can raise some of the money with Mistletoe sales and savings from our jobs, but are asking you to help us. This is beautiful and sacred New Mexico mixed conifer and oak forest. We are living small on the land with our 900 square foot home, water harvesting system and passive and active solar energy. Totally off grid. We build the house ourselves over a two year period of working weekends and evenings. Shannon and I both have jobs that we attend to help cover the costs of construction and the cost of the original 11 acres we bought five years ago. We are both dreaming of the day when we work full time on the Ranch. We will be faithful and dedicated stewards of this beautiful and gentle land. Come visit and see what makes this land so special.

Your Contribution Will Help Protect This Land

Help us protect this land with a contribution and we will send you a sample of the mistletoe we harvest, package and distribute. Other perks too.

Help Spread The Word

Spread the word about our plans here in New Mexico and if you are not able to contribute at this time, please send us some good thoughts and wishes in our efforts to expand this plant based business.

story:
The Details

Every December, the Dordt College community participates in a service project. This year, Dordt’s student-led sustainability committee has teamed up with Young Evangelicals for Climate Action (YECA) and the Evangelical Environmental Network (EEN) to organize a campus-wide sustainability initiative. We are challenging the Dordt community to reduce the amount of recyclable materials that end up in the trash by at least 50%. Through this project, we hope to educate the campus on how easy recycling can be and to instill an ethic of recycling in our community.

In addition to the recycling push, we are challenging the greater Dordt community to raise $10,000 for One Body, One Hope, a collaboration between Sioux Center and Liberian communities. These funds will be used to purchase solar panels that will allow the entire One Body, One Hope campus to be run on efficient, dependable solar energy. One campus reducing waste to enable another to do the same.

In order to pull this initiative off, Dordt needs to increase its capacity for recycling, specifically by purchasing attractive, 3-section recycling bins to be placed around campus. Dordt administration has agreed to invest $1,500 into this project granted that the Dordt sustainability committee can match it.

We believe that this project has the potential to create real transformation: transformation on Dordt's campus as students learn the skills to steward God's creation well. Transformation in Liberian communities as they install clean and dependable sources of energy to further fuel their ongoing work. And transformation of God's creation as harmful trash is kept out of landfills and dirty energy is taken offline.

Will you join us on this journey of transformation by giving today?

The Numbers

  • We want to purchase several 3-section recycling bins to be placed throughout Dordt's campus. Each bin costs $900.
  • All the money that we raise will go straight toward purchasing the bins. Even if we don't raise our entire goal, we will purchase as many bins as we can with the money that's raised.
  • Additional funds raised will go toward YECA's Climate Leadership Fellows program to help more campuses across the country take similar action on climate change.

The Impact

  • The recycling bins will educate 1,458 U.S. students about the importance of recycling and will empower them to make it a basic part of their Christian life of discipleship.
  • The recycling bins will reduce the quantity of recyclable material in the garbage at Dordt by 50% in the first year.
  • The story of the sustainability project will be shared with 18,000 alumni around the world.
  • The solar panels at the One Body, One Hope, Liberia campus will provide clean, dependable power for 642 children and adults.
 

Other Ways You Can Help

Not everyone can contribute financially, but that doesn't mean that you can't be a part of this campaign. Here are other ways that you can help:

  • Share this campaign on social media, or call up a handful of friends that you think might be interested in giving.
  • Lift up this campaign; the Dordt campus; and the One Body, One Hope community in prayer.

story:
[Historia y recompensas en Español más abajo]


It begins with a dream: To grow our own food,

but life many times has different plans for you, and we are not an exception.

As a volunteer and farm workers we realized that we are still taking more than we’re giving and we’re not letting nature to recover. Droughts, floods, erosion, hunger, deforestation, pollution, and climate change are the results of the life we’ve given to ourselves during the last 100 years. And even though some of us try to stand for nature and people, just some are not enough.

 

So what can we do?

Raices del Viento Learning Centre: A sustainable center for change.

NGO Permaculture Río Puelo is a nonprofit organization and an international permaculture centre that have the vision of being part of a cultural transformation while providing solutions for permanent abundance by training and empowering local and international people to become agents of change in their own communities and countries.

Our mission is to work with individuals and communities to teach and learn and expand the knowledge and practice of ecological agriculture, sustainable development, natural building, education, tourism and spirituality all under the ethics of permaculture.

It is, indeed, part of our mission to promote the decentralization and the grassroot expansion of permaculture in Chile and the world.

 

 

 

 

Where are we?

 

We are settled in Rio Puelo, Cochamó district, X Region de los Lagos, on the astonishing and threatened secret side of Patagonia, Chile.

This valley of great geographic extension, has been classified as an “extreme zone” due to its difficult access, poverty, it’s low number of inhabitants and the lack of public services like medical centers and high schools.  
In this hidden valley, families and communities live and practice their traditional knowledge related to agriculture, beekeeping, art crafts, animal husbandry and gastronomy. However, the impact of development as well as droughts, erosion and the silent approach of hydroelectrics had brought difficulties to the valley and generated a crisis/opportunity situation in which a transition must happen. This situation will determine the future of the valley, it’s nature and people.

Towards which way we want to go?  Towards the private and thoughtless or communal and thoughtful development? Towards the destruction and extraction of our natural resources or towards the sustainable development and use of this resources?

 

 

 

What do we want?

Protect this valley by:

  • Promote a sustainable agriculture
  • To work and share with our community
  • To educate and share knowledge
  • Bring back old traditions
  • Build resilience in our community and world
  • Find solutions to the local necessities (water shortage, production, yields, etc)

How?

So to be the transition and agent of change that we want to be, we must build our bedrock foundation for change. A Learning Centre with the infrastructure to gather our community, students and organizations in a comfortable space. This centre will have the following objectives:

  • Be a learning centre for permaculture and the exchange of knowledge
  • Contribute to the community through capacitation, volunteer programs and education
  • Be a space for the promotion of permaculture, agroecology and sustainable systems inside and outside the community.
  • Educate about the caring of the environment, sustainable agriculture, health, well being and the good living.

 

The Centre
 

 

With a capacity to accommodate 15 people and educate a maximum of 30 students, this center will generate its own energy through solar panels, store its own water through rain catchment and clean its gray waters with the use of an artificial wetland. It will produce food with an integrated experimental greenhouse and it will be built using a passive heating system.

The whole building has a total of 3 stages of construction, every stage represent a year of work:

1st “Learning hall” module

2nd Kitchen, Hallway and Greenhouse

3rd Dormitory

 

This 3 modules will be built around a central park that function as a plaza with an integrated artificial wetland. This area would serve as a leisure space.
The building stands for it’s self-sufficient capacity by using water collection, biofilter, and passive solar heating due to its position towards the sun, the maximization of the winter sun due to the location and angle of the windows and the U shape, acting as a solar trap.

 

About the Natural Builders

We will bring 5 great exponents and teachers around the Latin American circles of Natural Building. With their help we will impart a course, capacitate and self build our dreamed center. It’s a great honor to have the 5 disciples of the great Jorge Belanko, famous constructor and natural builder. Please check at the program HERE.

Raúl Macedo, originally from Uruguay, natural builder, has a wide experience in constructing  family dwellings, he is dedicated to the direction and counseling of constructions, promoting self construction and the reuse and repurposing of materials. He forms part of Terradobe together with Jorge Belanko, more info  Here

Gonzalo Castaño, argentinean,civil engineer, with experience in calculus of the structure in earth buildings. He is team member of EcoHacer together with Marco Aresta, he’s currently working at a project at a sustainable community in San Marco Sierras, Córdoba province, Argentina, called Yacumama. He’s also part of the Terradobe team together with Jorge Belanko. More info at: EcoHacer

Damián Cárdenas, argentinean, natural builder, has a great experience thanks to the work and journey with Jorge Belanko and Gernot Minke in many workshops around Latin America. He’s part of the collective group called “Manos en el Barro” (Hands in the Mud”) and Terradobe. More info about him here

Máximo Malaurie, argentinean, builder and facilitator of natural building. He began his experience with Jorge Belanko and currently he’s working with his project called “Barro para Todos” (Cob for Everyone), initiative that seeks to bring the experiences with clay to different socio-cultural contexts. He also formed an Architecture Studio called Xilema. He’s also a member of Terradobe. More info at: Xilema and Barro para Todos

 

What we need and for what?

The lumber will be taken from our site and from the nearby saw-mill sustainably, most of the construction will be undertaken by us with the help of our neighbors who will be paid for their work.

With the fundraise, we will bring great exponents and experts in Natural Building who will give a Course/Workshop for the ones who donated and got the Natural Building Perk. You can be one of the student for this unique experience. Get involved in this project and learn with such great teachers!

Materials and tools like roofing, solar panels, windows, isolating, etc. will be transported by a local truck driver and tractor to the nearest place.

Perks

Social Thanks (USD 10): Thank You So Much!, we will thank you through our social networks, website and more important, from our hearts.

Social Thanks +
Ebook with our Vegetarian Secret Recipes of Raíces del Viento (USD 15):
Collaborate by getting our exclusive recipe ebook where you’d find national and international preparations that we’ve learned and produce at Raíces del Viento: a mixed culinary traditions from Asia, Europe and Latin America, from North to South, East to West, recipes that our volunteers and guest loved.

Social Thanks + Ebook +
Wall of Fame (USD 25): At the entrance of our Learning Center it will be a 2x3 meters wide World Map, in there, your name and country will be present forever!. By doing so, every visitor, guest or student will know who helped us to achieve this dream.

Social Thanks + Ebook + Wall of Fame + Ebook "From Seed to Flower"
¡Choose & Plant a Tree! (USD 60): By Collaborating you will also be part of our Food Forest: You’ll be able to choose between fruit trees, bee forage trees and nitrogen fixers. You choose, we plant!
We will also add an Ebook with the essential tips and cares for growing plants "From Seed to Flower"

Social Thanks + Ebook +Wall of fame +
Adopt a Chicken (USD 100): At Raíces del Viento we chose for a Vegetarian diet, and our chickens love it! By adopting a chicken you are giving them a better and longer life. You will choose her name and we will send you reports of her lovely life: Health status, her first love, her first egg, among others.

Wall of Fame +
Early Bird, Natural Building Course (USD 450): Great opportunity to learn from natural building experts! 1 Week Course starting from 1st of February to the 7th. You’ll learn by doing different natural building techniques, passive solar heating system, efficient heating systems, proper mix, among others. Please check at the program HERE.

Social Thanks + Ebook + Wall of Fame + Tree
¡Be one of us! (USD 1000): For a whole month you’ll be part of the team Raíces del Viento, you will live with us, be able to know the area, fish and learn about Permaculture, Natural Building, Natural Medicine, forest systems and so much more!. You will also receive our official Staff T-Shirt.

 

The Team

 

Juan Pablo Rosas Zúñiga

Founder and President of the NGO Permacultura Río Puelo. Commercial Engineer and Certified Permaculturist by HASERA Nepal and Rak Tamachat Thailand. After been traveling, working and volunteering overseas Juan understands the need to build a sustainable life, sharing and giving back the experiences and teachings acquired.

Riina Rintala

Co-Fundador and Vice-President of NGO Permacultura Río Puelo. Her official profession is a Drama instructor but for recent years she’s been concentrating more into gardening and permaculture, studying her certificates in HASERA Nepal and Rak Tamachat Thailand. Spiritual growing and self-development are the main base of her life and the biggest tool the serve the planet and its inhabitants.

Raimundo I. Marchant Valderrama

Co-Founder and Director of NGO Permacultura Río Puelo. Currently coursing his 5th year of Engineering in Renewable Natural Resources in the University of Chile. His interests are tied to the territorial management, local development, biology of the conservation and ecological economics. Furthermore, the cultural management and education.

 

Valentina Rosas Zúñiga


Co founder and Directive secretary of ONG Permacultura Río Puelo. Integral natural therapist, she has been developing the  skills of Acupuncture, therapeutic massages and Bach flowers.
Currently coursing her formation about Family Constellations.

 

Felipe Araos Leiva

Directive member of NGO Permacultura Río Puelo, with a vocation related to farm work, construction and teamwork. Currently working with the design of the farm and its structures.

 

 
Other ways to help us

Spread the word by sharing this Campaign in your Social Networks, by sending emails or talking about it with your friends.

Use the tools that Indiegogo provides to share this Campaign!

Thank you so much for your time, interest and help.
Gracias!, Arigato!, Merci!, Hvala!, Kiitos!, Cheers!, Obrigado!, Tack!, Danke!, Dhanybhad!, Grazie!
 

:::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::
 

[Español]
 

Comenzó con un sueño: Cultivar nuestros propios alimentos, pero la vida muchas veces tiene otros planes para ti, y nosotros no fuimos la excepción.

Trabajando como voluntarios y en el campo, nos dimos cuenta que en el mundo estamos tomando más de lo que entregamos y no estamos permitiendo que la naturaleza se regenere. Sequías, inundaciones, erosión, hambruna, deforestación, contaminación y el cambio climático son los resultados de la vida que nos hemos dado durante el último siglo. Y si bien muchos intentan luchar por la naturaleza y las comunidades, no es suficiente.

 

¿Qué podemos hacer?

 

Centro de Aprendizaje Raíces del Viento: Un centro sustentable para el cambio.

ONG Permacultura Río Puelo es una organización sin fines de lucro y un centro internacional de Permacultura que tiene como visión ser parte de una transformación cultural, entregando soluciones para una abundancia permanente a través de la enseñanza y el empoderamiento tanto local como universal, generando agentes de cambio en distintas comunidades y países.

Nuestra misión es trabajar con individuos y comunidades, aprender y enseñar, y expandir el conocimiento y práctica de la agricultura ecológica, Bioconstrucción, educación, turismo sustentable y espiritualidad bajo las éticas de la Permacultura.

Es también parte de nuestra misión promover la descentralización y expansión de la Permacultura en Chile y el mundo.

 

¿Dónde estamos?

Estamos ubicados en Río Puelo, en la comuna de Cochamó, X Región de los Lagos, en la hermosa y amenazada Patagonia secreta de Chile.

Este valle, de gran extensión geográfica, ha sido clasificado como una “Zona extrema” debido a su difícil acceso, pobreza, bajo número de habitantes y la falta de servicios públicos tanto de centros médicos como de colegios. En este valle escondido, las familias y comunidades viven y practican métodos tradicionales de agricultura, apicultura, artesanías, ganadería y gastronomía. Sin embargo, el alto impacto de un turismo sin planificación, el impacto del cambio climático y el silencioso avance de las industrias de la energía han traído dificultades y generado una crisis/oportunidad en donde una transición debe llevarse a cabo. Esta situación, determinará el futuro del valle, su naturaleza y gente.

¿Hacia dónde queremos dirigirnos? ¿Hacia el desarrollo privado y desconsiderado o hacia el desarrollo comunal y precavido?, ¿Hacia la destrucción y extracción de los recursos naturales o hacia el desarrollo y uso sustentable de éstos?

 

 

 

¿Qué es lo que queremos?

 

Proteger este valle mediante las siguientes estrategias:

  • Promover un desarrollo agroecológico
  • Trabajar y compartir con nuestra comunidad
  • Educar e intercambiar los conocimientos
  • Empoderar a la comunidad y revivir tradiciones ancestrales
  • Construir resiliencia en la comunidad y promoverla en el mundo.
  • Buscar y entregar soluciones a las necesidades locales: Escasez de agua, capacitaciones, condición de los suelos, altos costos de producción, etc.

¿Cómo?

Para ser la transición y el agente de cambio que queremos ser, debemos construir nuestra piedra fundacional para el cambio: un centro de aprendizaje con la infraestructura suficiente para reunir a la comunidad, estudiantes y organizaciones en un espacio cómodo. Este centro tendrá los siguientes objetivos:

  • Ser un centro para el aprendizaje de Permacultura y el intercambio de conocimientos y disciplinas
  • Ser un aporte para la comunidad, promoviendo la articulación comunitaria, entrega de capacitaciones, programas de voluntariados e impartición de educación formal e informal.
  • Ser un espacio para la enseñanza de la permacultura, agroecología, sistemas sustentables y educación ambiental, dentro y fuera de la comunidad.
  • Educar sobre el cuidado del medio ambiente, la salud, el bienestar y el buen vivir.


El Centro

 

Con capacidad para alojar a 16 personas, además de una sala de clases para 30 personas, este centro generará su propia energía a través de paneles fotovoltaicos, almacenará su propia agua captando el agua lluvia desde los techos y limpiará sus aguas grises con un sistema de humedal con plantas depuradoras actuando como un biofiltro.

 

El edificio completo está pensado en tres etapas de construcción, cada etapa representa 1 año de trabajo y tiempo.

1ra etapa: Construcción de Eco-escuela

2da etapa: Cocina, pasillo e invernadero experimental.

3ra etapa: Módulo de dormitorios.

 

Todos estos programas se construirán en torno a un patio central el cual funciona como una plaza con un humedal artificial integrado donde se podrán desarrollar actividades de ocio.

Se destaca la capacidad autosuficiente del edificio, utilizando sistemas de recolección de aguas, purificación de las aguas grises y una calefacción solar pasiva gracias a su posición con respecto al sol y la maximización de la luz solar durante el invierno, actuando como una “trampa solar” debido a la disposición de los módulos y su forma de U.

 

Bioconstructores

Traeremos a 5 grandes exponentes de la Bioconstrucción Latinoamericana quienes realizarán un curso, capacitarán y nos ayudarán a construir el deseado centro. Estos 5 constructores son también discípulos del gran Jorge Belanko. Para más información revisa el programa AQUI.

Raúl Macedo, originario de Uruguay, constructor natural, con amplia experiencia en la construcción de viviendas familiares, se dedica al asesoramiento y dirección de obra, fomentando la autoconstrucción y la reutilización de materiales. Ha dado talleres junto a Jorge Belanko y es parte del equipo Terradobe más info: Aquí

Gonzalo Castaño, argentino, ingeniero civil, con experiencia en cálculo de estructura en construcción con tierra. Forma parte del equipo EcoHacer junto a Marco Aresta, actualmente lleva adelante un proyecto de comunidad sostenible en San Marco Sierras, prov de Córdoba, Argentina. Llamado Yacumama. Ha dado talleres junto a Jorge Belanko y es parte del equipo Terradobe más info: EcoHacer

Damián Cárdenas, argentino, constructor natural, ha hecho un amplio recorrido acompañando a Jorge Belanko y Gernot Minke en talleres por Latinoamérica. También forma parte del colectivo Manos en Barro y del equipo Terradobe. Más info Aquí

Máximo Malaurie, argentino, constructor y formador en construcción natural. Ha iniciado su experiencia junto a Jorge Belanko, y actualmente lleva adelante el proyecto Barro Para Todos, que busca acercar la experiencia del barro a diferentes contextos socioculturales. También ha formado un estudio de arquitectura, llamado Xilema, el cual se aboca a realizar proyecto y obra. Forma parte del equipo Terradobe. Más info: Xilema , Barro para Todos

 

¿Cuánto necesitamos y para qué?

Gran parte de la madera será sacada de nuestra tierra y de un aserradero local, el trabajo de obra será realizado por nosotros mismos y la ayuda de nuestros vecinos quienes serán remunerados.

Con lo recaudado, traeremos a grandes exponentes de la Bioconstrucción quienes también darán un curso para quienes optaron por la recompensa correspondiente. Aprovecha esta gran oportunidad para hacerte parte de este proyecto y aprender con maestros de la construcción natural.
Los materiales y herramientas como techumbre, paneles solares, ventanas, aislación, etc. serán transportados por camión y tractor hasta el lugar más cercano.

 

Recompensas

Gracias sociales (USD 10): ¡Muchas gracias!, te lo agradeceremos a través de nuestras redes sociales, nuestra página web y más importante, del fondo de nuestros corazones.

Gracias sociales +
Ebook con las secretas recetas vegetarianas de Raíces del Viento (USD 15):
Podrás aportar a nuestra causa y a la vez acceder a un recetario exclusivo donde encontrarás las recetas internacionales que hemos hecho en Raíces: una mezcla de tradiciones culinarias tanto del extremo norte del mundo como de este extremo sur que no han dejado de cautivar a nuestros visitantes.


Gracias Sociales + Ebook +
Muro de la Fama (USD 25): En la entrada de nuestro centro de aprendizaje habrá un gran mapa del mundo, donde indicaremos de dónde provienes y tu nombre. Así, todo quien visite Raíces sabrá de dónde vino la ayuda para construir este sueño.

Todo lo anterior +  Ebook Especial "De semilla a Flor"
¡Escoge y planta un árbol! (USD 60): Colabora por un bosque comestible: podrás elegir entre árboles frutales, melíferos y fijadores de nitrógeno. ¡Tu decides!
Ebook "De Semilla a flor" entrega tips y cuidados esenciales para un cultivo exitoso.

Gracias Sociales + Muro de la Fama + Ebook +
Apadrina una gallina (USD 100): En Raíces del Viento optamos por tener una dieta vegetariana ¡y nuestras gallinas lo aman!. Al adoptar a una gallina te aseguras de que tenga los cuidados suficientes y viva hasta su muerte natural. Le podrás poner un nombre, y te iremos enviando actualizaciones: su primer huevo, sus relaciones amorosas, su estado de salud, entre otros.

Gracias Sociales + Muro de la fama + Ebook +
Early Bird, Curso de Bioconstrucción (USD 450): Gran oportunidad para aprender Bioconstrucción con grandes exponentes de la construcción natural. Curso de 1 semana durante el 1ro de Febrero hasta el 7, donde abordaremos: técnicas tradicionales de construcción, sistemas de calefacción eficiente, diseño solar pasivo, mezcla ideal, entre otras. Para más información revisa el programa AQUI.

Gracias Sociales + Ebook + Muro de la Fama + Árbol
¡Sé uno de nosotros! (USD 1000): Por un mes serás parte del equipo de Raíces, podrás vivir y conocer la zona a placer, pescar, adentrarte en el mundo de la Permacultura, la bioconstrucción, medicina natural, los bosques y muchas cosas más. Además recibirás la polera oficial del Equipo!

El equipo

 

Juan Pablo Rosas Zúñiga

 Fundador y Presidente de Permacultura Río Puelo. Ingeniero Comercial y    Permacultura Certificado en HASERA Nepal y Rak Tamachat Tailandia.  Luego de viajar, trabajar y estudiar en el extranjero comprende la  necesidad de construir una vida sostenible y devolver las experiencias y aprendizajes adquiridos.

Riina Rintala

  Co-Fundadora y Vice-Presidenta de Permacultura Río Puelo. Instructora de   Drama y Permacultora certificada en HASERA Nepal y Rak Tamachat              Tailandia. El crecimiento y desarrollo tanto espiritual como interno son la  gran base de su vida y la mayor herramienta para servir al planeta y sus  habitantes.

 

Raimundo I. Marchant Valderrama

 Co-Fundador y Director de ONG Permacultura Río Puelo. Estudiante de 5to  año de Ingeniería en Recursos Naturales Renovables en la Universidad de  Chile. Sus intereses están asociados a la gestión territorial, el desarrollo local,  la biología de la conservación y la economía ecológica. Por otro lado, la  gestión cultural y la educación.

 

Valentina Rosas Zúñiga

 Co-fundadora y Secretaria directiva de ONG Permacultura Río Puelo.  Titulada como Terapeuta en Salud Integral, desarrolla las técnicas de la  Acupuntura, Flores de Bach y Masajes terapéuticos.
 Actualmente cursando formación en constelaciones familiares.

 

Felipe Araos Leiva

 Miembro directivo de la ONG Permacultura Río Puelo, llega a Raíces con una  gran vocación en el trabajo de campo y equipo, para apoyar en el desarrollo de  proyectos y el funcionamiento íntegro de nuestra tierra.

 

 

Otras maneras de ayudarnos

  • Genera eco al compartir esta campaña en tus Redes Sociales, enviando correos electrónicos o simplemente conversándolo con tus amigos.
  • Usa las herramientas de Indiegogo para compartir esta campaña!


Muchas gracias por tu tiempo, colaboración, ayuda e interés!!

Gracias!, Arigato!, Merci!, Hvala!, Kiitos!, Cheers!, Obrigado!, Tack!, Danke!, Dhanybhad!, Grazie!
