but life many times has different plans for you, and we are not an exception.As a volunteer and farm workers we realized that we are still taking more than we’re giving and we’re not letting nature to recover. Droughts, floods, erosion, hunger, deforestation, pollution, and climate change are the results of the life we’ve given to ourselves during the last 100 years. And even though some of us try to stand for nature and people, just some are not enough. So what can we do?Raices del Viento Learning Centre: A sustainable center for change.NGO Permaculture Río Puelo is a nonprofit organization and an international permaculture centre that have the vision of being part of a cultural transformation while providing solutions for permanent abundance by training and empowering local and international people to become agents of change in their own communities and countries.Our mission is to work with individuals and communities to teach and learn and expand the knowledge and practice of ecological agriculture, sustainable development, natural building, education, tourism and spirituality all under the ethics of permaculture.It is, indeed, part of our mission to promote the decentralization and the grassroot expansion of permaculture in Chile and the world.    Where are we? We are settled in Rio Puelo, Cochamó district, X Region de los Lagos, on the astonishing and threatened secret side of Patagonia, Chile.This valley of great geographic extension, has been classified as an “extreme zone” due to its difficult access, poverty, it’s low number of inhabitants and the lack of public services like medical centers and high schools.  In this hidden valley, families and communities live and practice their traditional knowledge related to agriculture, beekeeping, art crafts, animal husbandry and gastronomy. However, the impact of development as well as droughts, erosion and the silent approach of hydroelectrics had brought difficulties to the valley and generated a crisis/opportunity situation in which a transition must happen. This situation will determine the future of the valley, it’s nature and people.Towards which way we want to go?  Towards the private and thoughtless or communal and thoughtful development? Towards the destruction and extraction of our natural resources or towards the sustainable development and use of this resources?   What do we want?Protect this valley by:
Promote a sustainable agriculture
To work and share with our community
To educate and share knowledge
Bring back old traditions
Build resilience in our community and world
Find solutions to the local necessities (water shortage, production, yields, etc)
How?So to be the transition and agent of change that we want to be, we must build our bedrock foundation for change. A Learning Centre with the infrastructure to gather our community, students and organizations in a comfortable space. This centre will have the following objectives:
Be a learning centre for permaculture and the exchange of knowledge
Contribute to the community through capacitation, volunteer programs and education
Be a space for the promotion of permaculture, agroecology and sustainable systems inside and outside the community.
Educate about the caring of the environment, sustainable agriculture, health, well being and the good living.
 The Centre  With a capacity to accommodate 15 people and educate a maximum of 30 students, this center will generate its own energy through solar panels, store its own water through rain catchment and clean its gray waters with the use of an artificial wetland. It will produce food with an integrated experimental greenhouse and it will be built using a passive heating system.The whole building has a total of 3 stages of construction, every stage represent a year of work:1st “Learning hall” module2nd Kitchen, Hallway and Greenhouse3rd Dormitory This 3 modules will be built around a central park that function as a plaza with an integrated artificial wetland. This area would serve as a leisure space.The building stands for it’s self-sufficient capacity by using water collection, biofilter, and passive solar heating due to its position towards the sun, the maximization of the winter sun due to the location and angle of the windows and the U shape, acting as a solar trap. About the Natural BuildersWe will bring 5 great exponents and teachers around the Latin American circles of Natural Building. With their help we will impart a course, capacitate and self build our dreamed center. It’s a great honor to have the 5 disciples of the great Jorge Belanko, famous constructor and natural builder. Please check at the program HERE.Raúl Macedo, originally from Uruguay, natural builder, has a wide experience in constructing  family dwellings, he is dedicated to the direction and counseling of constructions, promoting self construction and the reuse and repurposing of materials. He forms part of Terradobe together with Jorge Belanko, more info  HereGonzalo Castaño, argentinean,civil engineer, with experience in calculus of the structure in earth buildings. He is team member of EcoHacer together with Marco Aresta, he’s currently working at a project at a sustainable community in San Marco Sierras, Córdoba province, Argentina, called Yacumama. He’s also part of the Terradobe team together with Jorge Belanko. More info at: EcoHacerDamián Cárdenas, argentinean, natural builder, has a great experience thanks to the work and journey with Jorge Belanko and Gernot Minke in many workshops around Latin America. He’s part of the collective group called “Manos en el Barro” (Hands in the Mud”) and Terradobe. More info about him hereMáximo Malaurie, argentinean, builder and facilitator of natural building. He began his experience with Jorge Belanko and currently he’s working with his project called “Barro para Todos” (Cob for Everyone), initiative that seeks to bring the experiences with clay to different socio-cultural contexts. He also formed an Architecture Studio called Xilema. He’s also a member of Terradobe. More info at: Xilema and Barro para Todos What we need and for what?The lumber will be taken from our site and from the nearby saw-mill sustainably, most of the construction will be undertaken by us with the help of our neighbors who will be paid for their work.With the fundraise, we will bring great exponents and experts in Natural Building who will give a Course/Workshop for the ones who donated and got the Natural Building Perk. You can be one of the student for this unique experience. Get involved in this project and learn with such great teachers!Materials and tools like roofing, solar panels, windows, isolating, etc. will be transported by a local truck driver and tractor to the nearest place.PerksSocial Thanks (USD 10): Thank You So Much!, we will thank you through our social networks, website and more important, from our hearts.Social Thanks +Ebook with our Vegetarian Secret Recipes of Raíces del Viento (USD 15):Collaborate by getting our exclusive recipe ebook where you’d find national and international preparations that we’ve learned and produce at Raíces del Viento: a mixed culinary traditions from Asia, Europe and Latin America, from North to South, East to West, recipes that our volunteers and guest loved.Social Thanks + Ebook +Wall of Fame (USD 25): At the entrance of our Learning Center it will be a 2x3 meters wide World Map, in there, your name and country will be present forever!. By doing so, every visitor, guest or student will know who helped us to achieve this dream.Social Thanks + Ebook + Wall of Fame + Ebook "From Seed to Flower"¡Choose & Plant a Tree! (USD 60): By Collaborating you will also be part of our Food Forest: You’ll be able to choose between fruit trees, bee forage trees and nitrogen fixers. You choose, we plant!We will also add an Ebook with the essential tips and cares for growing plants "From Seed to Flower"Social Thanks + Ebook +Wall of fame +Adopt a Chicken (USD 100): At Raíces del Viento we chose for a Vegetarian diet, and our chickens love it! By adopting a chicken you are giving them a better and longer life. You will choose her name and we will send you reports of her lovely life: Health status, her first love, her first egg, among others.Wall of Fame +Early Bird, Natural Building Course (USD 450): Great opportunity to learn from natural building experts! 1 Week Course starting from 1st of February to the 7th. You’ll learn by doing different natural building techniques, passive solar heating system, efficient heating systems, proper mix, among others. Please check at the program HERE.Social Thanks + Ebook + Wall of Fame + Tree¡Be one of us! (USD 1000): For a whole month you’ll be part of the team Raíces del Viento, you will live with us, be able to know the area, fish and learn about Permaculture, Natural Building, Natural Medicine, forest systems and so much more!. You will also receive our official Staff T-Shirt. The Team Juan Pablo Rosas ZúñigaFounder and President of the NGO Permacultura Río Puelo. Commercial Engineer and Certified Permaculturist by HASERA Nepal and Rak Tamachat Thailand. After been traveling, working and volunteering overseas Juan understands the need to build a sustainable life, sharing and giving back the experiences and teachings acquired.Riina RintalaCo-Fundador and Vice-President of NGO Permacultura Río Puelo. Her official profession is a Drama instructor but for recent years she’s been concentrating more into gardening and permaculture, studying her certificates in HASERA Nepal and Rak Tamachat Thailand. Spiritual growing and self-development are the main base of her life and the biggest tool the serve the planet and its inhabitants.Raimundo I. Marchant ValderramaCo-Founder and Director of NGO Permacultura Río Puelo. Currently coursing his 5th year of Engineering in Renewable Natural Resources in the University of Chile. His interests are tied to the territorial management, local development, biology of the conservation and ecological economics. Furthermore, the cultural management and education. Valentina Rosas ZúñigaCo founder and Directive secretary of ONG Permacultura Río Puelo. Integral natural therapist, she has been developing the  skills of Acupuncture, therapeutic massages and Bach flowers.Currently coursing her formation about Family Constellations. Felipe Araos LeivaDirective member of NGO Permacultura Río Puelo, with a vocation related to farm work, construction and teamwork. Currently working with the design of the farm and its structures.  Other ways to help us
Spread the word by sharing this Campaign in your Social Networks, by sending emails or talking about it with your friends.
Use the tools that Indiegogo provides to share this Campaign!
Thank you so much for your time, interest and help.Gracias!, Arigato!, Merci!, Hvala!, Kiitos!, Cheers!, Obrigado!, Tack!, Danke!, Dhanybhad!, Grazie! 
::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::: 

[Español] 

Comenzó con un sueño: Cultivar nuestros propios alimentos, pero la vida muchas veces tiene otros planes para ti, y nosotros no fuimos la excepción.
Trabajando como voluntarios y en el campo, nos dimos cuenta que en el mundo estamos tomando más de lo que entregamos y no estamos permitiendo que la naturaleza se regenere. Sequías, inundaciones, erosión, hambruna, deforestación, contaminación y el cambio climático son los resultados de la vida que nos hemos dado durante el último siglo. Y si bien muchos intentan luchar por la naturaleza y las comunidades, no es suficiente.
 
¿Qué podemos hacer?
 
Centro de Aprendizaje Raíces del Viento: Un centro sustentable para el cambio.
ONG Permacultura Río Puelo es una organización sin fines de lucro y un centro internacional de Permacultura que tiene como visión ser parte de una transformación cultural, entregando soluciones para una abundancia permanente a través de la enseñanza y el empoderamiento tanto local como universal, generando agentes de cambio en distintas comunidades y países.
Nuestra misión es trabajar con individuos y comunidades, aprender y enseñar, y expandir el conocimiento y práctica de la agricultura ecológica, Bioconstrucción, educación, turismo sustentable y espiritualidad bajo las éticas de la Permacultura.
Es también parte de nuestra misión promover la descentralización y expansión de la Permacultura en Chile y el mundo.
 
¿Dónde estamos?

Estamos ubicados en Río Puelo, en la comuna de Cochamó, X Región de los Lagos, en la hermosa y amenazada Patagonia secreta de Chile.
Este valle, de gran extensión geográfica, ha sido clasificado como una “Zona extrema” debido a su difícil acceso, pobreza, bajo número de habitantes y la falta de servicios públicos tanto de centros médicos como de colegios. En este valle escondido, las familias y comunidades viven y practican métodos tradicionales de agricultura, apicultura, artesanías, ganadería y gastronomía. Sin embargo, el alto impacto de un turismo sin planificación, el impacto del cambio climático y el silencioso avance de las industrias de la energía han traído dificultades y generado una crisis/oportunidad en donde una transición debe llevarse a cabo. Esta situación, determinará el futuro del valle, su naturaleza y gente.

¿Hacia dónde queremos dirigirnos? ¿Hacia el desarrollo privado y desconsiderado o hacia el desarrollo comunal y precavido?, ¿Hacia la destrucción y extracción de los recursos naturales o hacia el desarrollo y uso sustentable de éstos?
 
 

 
¿Qué es lo que queremos?
 
Proteger este valle mediante las siguientes estrategias:

Promover un desarrollo agroecológico
Trabajar y compartir con nuestra comunidad
Educar e intercambiar los conocimientos
Empoderar a la comunidad y revivir tradiciones ancestrales
Construir resiliencia en la comunidad y promoverla en el mundo.
Buscar y entregar soluciones a las necesidades locales: Escasez de agua, capacitaciones, condición de los suelos, altos costos de producción, etc.

¿Cómo?
Para ser la transición y el agente de cambio que queremos ser, debemos construir nuestra piedra fundacional para el cambio: un centro de aprendizaje con la infraestructura suficiente para reunir a la comunidad, estudiantes y organizaciones en un espacio cómodo. Este centro tendrá los siguientes objetivos:

Ser un centro para el aprendizaje de Permacultura y el intercambio de conocimientos y disciplinas
Ser un aporte para la comunidad, promoviendo la articulación comunitaria, entrega de capacitaciones, programas de voluntariados e impartición de educación formal e informal.
Ser un espacio para la enseñanza de la permacultura, agroecología, sistemas sustentables y educación ambiental, dentro y fuera de la comunidad.
Educar sobre el cuidado del medio ambiente, la salud, el bienestar y el buen vivir.


El Centro
 

Con capacidad para alojar a 16 personas, además de una sala de clases para 30 personas, este centro generará su propia energía a través de paneles fotovoltaicos, almacenará su propia agua captando el agua lluvia desde los techos y limpiará sus aguas grises con un sistema de humedal con plantas depuradoras actuando como un biofiltro.

 
El edificio completo está pensado en tres etapas de construcción, cada etapa representa 1 año de trabajo y tiempo.
1ra etapa: Construcción de Eco-escuela
2da etapa: Cocina, pasillo e invernadero experimental.
3ra etapa: Módulo de dormitorios.

 
Todos estos programas se construirán en torno a un patio central el cual funciona como una plaza con un humedal artificial integrado donde se podrán desarrollar actividades de ocio.
Se destaca la capacidad autosuficiente del edificio, utilizando sistemas de recolección de aguas, purificación de las aguas grises y una calefacción solar pasiva gracias a su posición con respecto al sol y la maximización de la luz solar durante el invierno, actuando como una “trampa solar” debido a la disposición de los módulos y su forma de U.

 
Bioconstructores
Traeremos a 5 grandes exponentes de la Bioconstrucción Latinoamericana quienes realizarán un curso, capacitarán y nos ayudarán a construir el deseado centro. Estos 5 constructores son también discípulos del gran Jorge Belanko. Para más información revisa el programa AQUI.
Raúl Macedo, originario de Uruguay, constructor natural, con amplia experiencia en la construcción de viviendas familiares, se dedica al asesoramiento y dirección de obra, fomentando la autoconstrucción y la reutilización de materiales. Ha dado talleres junto a Jorge Belanko y es parte del equipo Terradobe más info: Aquí
Gonzalo Castaño, argentino, ingeniero civil, con experiencia en cálculo de estructura en construcción con tierra. Forma parte del equipo EcoHacer junto a Marco Aresta, actualmente lleva adelante un proyecto de comunidad sostenible en San Marco Sierras, prov de Córdoba, Argentina. Llamado Yacumama. Ha dado talleres junto a Jorge Belanko y es parte del equipo Terradobe más info: EcoHacer
Damián Cárdenas, argentino, constructor natural, ha hecho un amplio recorrido acompañando a Jorge Belanko y Gernot Minke en talleres por Latinoamérica. También forma parte del colectivo Manos en Barro y del equipo Terradobe. Más info Aquí
Máximo Malaurie, argentino, constructor y formador en construcción natural. Ha iniciado su experiencia junto a Jorge Belanko, y actualmente lleva adelante el proyecto Barro Para Todos, que busca acercar la experiencia del barro a diferentes contextos socioculturales. También ha formado un estudio de arquitectura, llamado Xilema, el cual se aboca a realizar proyecto y obra. Forma parte del equipo Terradobe. Más info: Xilema , Barro para Todos
 
¿Cuánto necesitamos y para qué?

Gran parte de la madera será sacada de nuestra tierra y de un aserradero local, el trabajo de obra será realizado por nosotros mismos y la ayuda de nuestros vecinos quienes serán remunerados.
Con lo recaudado, traeremos a grandes exponentes de la Bioconstrucción quienes también darán un curso para quienes optaron por la recompensa correspondiente. Aprovecha esta gran oportunidad para hacerte parte de este proyecto y aprender con maestros de la construcción natural.Los materiales y herramientas como techumbre, paneles solares, ventanas, aislación, etc. serán transportados por camión y tractor hasta el lugar más cercano.

 
Recompensas
Gracias sociales (USD 10): ¡Muchas gracias!, te lo agradeceremos a través de nuestras redes sociales, nuestra página web y más importante, del fondo de nuestros corazones.
Gracias sociales +Ebook con las secretas recetas vegetarianas de Raíces del Viento (USD 15):Podrás aportar a nuestra causa y a la vez acceder a un recetario exclusivo donde encontrarás las recetas internacionales que hemos hecho en Raíces: una mezcla de tradiciones culinarias tanto del extremo norte del mundo como de este extremo sur que no han dejado de cautivar a nuestros visitantes.
Gracias Sociales + Ebook +Muro de la Fama (USD 25): En la entrada de nuestro centro de aprendizaje habrá un gran mapa del mundo, donde indicaremos de dónde provienes y tu nombre. Así, todo quien visite Raíces sabrá de dónde vino la ayuda para construir este sueño.Todo lo anterior +  Ebook Especial "De semilla a Flor"¡Escoge y planta un árbol! (USD 60): Colabora por un bosque comestible: podrás elegir entre árboles frutales, melíferos y fijadores de nitrógeno. ¡Tu decides!Ebook "De Semilla a flor" entrega tips y cuidados esenciales para un cultivo exitoso.Gracias Sociales + Muro de la Fama + Ebook +Apadrina una gallina (USD 100): En Raíces del Viento optamos por tener una dieta vegetariana ¡y nuestras gallinas lo aman!. Al adoptar a una gallina te aseguras de que tenga los cuidados suficientes y viva hasta su muerte natural. Le podrás poner un nombre, y te iremos enviando actualizaciones: su primer huevo, sus relaciones amorosas, su estado de salud, entre otros.
Gracias Sociales + Muro de la fama + Ebook +Early Bird, Curso de Bioconstrucción (USD 450): Gran oportunidad para aprender Bioconstrucción con grandes exponentes de la construcción natural. Curso de 1 semana durante el 1ro de Febrero hasta el 7, donde abordaremos: técnicas tradicionales de construcción, sistemas de calefacción eficiente, diseño solar pasivo, mezcla ideal, entre otras. Para más información revisa el programa AQUI.
Gracias Sociales + Ebook + Muro de la Fama + Árbol¡Sé uno de nosotros! (USD 1000): Por un mes serás parte del equipo de Raíces, podrás vivir y conocer la zona a placer, pescar, adentrarte en el mundo de la Permacultura, la bioconstrucción, medicina natural, los bosques y muchas cosas más. Además recibirás la polera oficial del Equipo!
El equipo

 
Juan Pablo Rosas Zúñiga
 Fundador y Presidente de Permacultura Río Puelo. Ingeniero Comercial y    Permacultura Certificado en HASERA Nepal y Rak Tamachat Tailandia.  Luego de viajar, trabajar y estudiar en el extranjero comprende la  necesidad de construir una vida sostenible y devolver las experiencias y aprendizajes adquiridos.
Riina Rintala
  Co-Fundadora y Vice-Presidenta de Permacultura Río Puelo. Instructora de   Drama y Permacultora certificada en HASERA Nepal y Rak Tamachat              Tailandia. El crecimiento y desarrollo tanto espiritual como interno son la  gran base de su vida y la mayor herramienta para servir al planeta y sus  habitantes.
 
Raimundo I. Marchant Valderrama
 Co-Fundador y Director de ONG Permacultura Río Puelo. Estudiante de 5to  año de Ingeniería en Recursos Naturales Renovables en la Universidad de  Chile. Sus intereses están asociados a la gestión territorial, el desarrollo local,  la biología de la conservación y la economía ecológica. Por otro lado, la  gestión cultural y la educación.
 
Valentina Rosas Zúñiga
 Co-fundadora y Secretaria directiva de ONG Permacultura Río Puelo.  Titulada como Terapeuta en Salud Integral, desarrolla las técnicas de la  Acupuntura, Flores de Bach y Masajes terapéuticos. Actualmente cursando formación en constelaciones familiares.
 
Felipe Araos Leiva
 Miembro directivo de la ONG Permacultura Río Puelo, llega a Raíces con una  gran vocación en el trabajo de campo y equipo, para apoyar en el desarrollo de  proyectos y el funcionamiento íntegro de nuestra tierra.
 
 
Otras maneras de ayudarnos

Genera eco al compartir esta campaña en tus Redes Sociales, enviando correos electrónicos o simplemente conversándolo con tus amigos.
Usa las herramientas de Indiegogo para compartir esta campaña!

Muchas gracias por tu tiempo, colaboración, ayuda e interés!!
Gracias!, Arigato!, Merci!, Hvala!, Kiitos!, Cheers!, Obrigado!, Tack!, Danke!, Dhanybhad!, Grazie!

story:
Pourquoi donner?

Des pancartes reniant l’influence des humains dans le rôle des changements climatiques ont fait leur apparition sur l'autoroute 40 dans la région de Montréal. Cette imposture scientifique est une nouvelle attaque envers l’intelligence des Québécois, et envers la culture scientifique que nous bâtissons depuis plusieurs décennies. Elle est d’autant plus vicieuse que ses auteurs, Friends of science, un organisme climatosceptique albertain, prétendent parler au nom de la science et usurpent sa crédibilité pour désinformer la population.

Why donate?

Billboards denying the influence of humans on climate change have begun to appear along Autoroute 40 around Montreal. This scientific misinformation is yet another attack on Québecers’ intelligence and on the scientific literacy we have been building for many years. Even more perverse is that Friends of Science – the Alberta-based climate skeptic group behind the billboards – claims to speak on behalf of science and is using the credibility of science to mislead the public. 

Photo : Daniel-Jean Primeau 

Il faut réagir pour empêcher ces messages dangereux de s'implanter, des messages qui minent les efforts que nous faisons pour contrer les changements climatiques. Et nous souhaitons affirmer, par tous les moyens possibles, que la désinformation scientifique n'est pas la bienvenue en sol québécois.

Avec votre appui, nous répliquons à cette campagne de désinformation scientifique en installant 3 panneaux sur les autoroutes 40 et 440, dans la région montréalaise. Un partenaire nous offre le graphisme et nous avons obtenu un rabais de près de 70% pour la production de ces panneaux, ciblant chacun entre 50 000 et 80 000 personnes par jour. Une occasion inespérée d'agir!

Cette riposte nous donnera l'occasion d'attirer l'attention du public sur la nécessité de préserver notre culture scientifique et de l'éduquer sur les mythes existants.

Aidez-nous en participant au financement de cette riposte pour rétablir les faits sur les changements climatiques et plus généralement pour garantir le droit à une information scientifique juste et de qualité!

-----

We must take action to prevent such dangerous messages from taking hold – messages that undermine our efforts to counteract climate change. We also want to state loudly and clearly, by every means possible, that scientific disinformation is not welcome in Québec.

With your support, we can respond to this campaign by installing three billboards along Autoroutes 40 and 440 in the Montreal region. A partner is providing the graphic design free of charge, and we are getting a 70% discount on producing the billboards, each of which will reach 50,000 to 80,000 people per day. It’s a golden opportunity to act!

This response will also be an opportunity to draw public attention to the need to preserve scientific literacy and to debunk existing myths.

You can help to re-establish the facts about climate change and, more broadly, to guarantee the right to accurate, high-quality scientific information, by funding this campaign. 

Message des panneaux

Les panneaux interpellent les panneaux de Friends of Science.

[billboard text: What science really says: The climate is changing. Because of us.]

Notre message s’appuie notamment sur les conclusions du cinquième rapport sur les changements climatiques du Groupe d’experts intergouvernemental sur l’évolution du climat (GIEC) précisant que « il est extrêmement probable que l'humain est la cause dominante du réchauffement climatique depuis la seconde moitié du 20ème siècle. »

Ce message a été validé par plusieurs scientifiques, journalistes, vulgarisateurs et muséologues scientifiques. 

Billboard message

The billboards will be reminiscent of the Friends of Science message.

Our message is based on the conclusions of the fifth assessment report on climate change by the Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change (IPCC), which states that humans are “extremely likely to have been the dominant cause of the observed warming since the mid-20th century.”

This message has been validated by many scientists, journalists, science writers, and science museum curators. 

Comment sera employé votre argent?

L'argent recueilli servira :

  • aux frais de production et d’affichage des panneaux;

  • à la location d’espace sur les autoroutes 440 et 40;

  • à la promotion de la campagne;

  • à la coordination de la campagne auprès des médias et des partenaires.

Au-delà de 10 000$ (cet objectif est maintenant atteint!), l’argent servira donc à poursuivre la mission d'ACS qui consiste notamment à:

  • dénoncer d'autres actions de désinformation scientifique ou de manipulation de l'information scientifique;
  • soutenir les communicateurs scientifiques québécois;
  • organiser des actions et mettre en place des outils visant à former les communicateurs scientifiques et le public pour répliquer aux faux arguments scientifiques et mieux déchiffrer l’actualité scientifique.
Une première page d'information sur les répliques aux arguments des climatosceptiques vient d'être mise en ligne: http://www.acs.qc.ca/actualite/168-comprendre-l... et nous traduisons nos documents en anglais.

How will your donation be used? 

The funds we collect will go toward:

  • billboard production and display costs,

  • leasing of billboard space along Autoroutes 440 and 40,

  • campaign promotion,

  • campaign coordination with media and partners.

Beyond $10,000, the funds will go toward continuing the mission of the ACS, which includes:

  • denouncing other instances of scientific misinformation or of manipulation of scientific data,
  • support Quebec's science communicators,
  • organizing actions and developing tools to teach scientific communicators and the public how to respond to false scientific arguments and better interpret science news.

Qui sommes-nous?

L’Association des communicateurs scientifiques du Québec (ACS) est le plus important regroupement de professionnels de la communication scientifique au Québec. Ses membres exercent dans le milieu journalistique et muséal ainsi que dans le réseau des universités québécoises, les médias, les écoles et les lieux de diffusion scientifique.

Depuis 37 ans, l’ACS défend le droit à une information scientifique de qualité au Québec. Elle organise notamment la bourse Fernand-Seguin et le prix Hubert-Reeves.

En 2012, l’ACS a reçu le Prix de la liberté de presse par le Comité canadien pour la liberté de presse et une bourse décernée par la Commission canadienne de l’UNESCO pour avoir alerté le public et la communauté scientifique internationale sur le musèlement des scientifiques canadiens. (http://bit.ly/1FsuUom)

Cette campagne est organisée par une quinzaine de bénévoles, communicateurs et journalistes scientifiques, issus de tous les milieux : magazines, émissions de télé, musées, entreprises de vulgarisation, universités. 

Who are we?

The Québec association of scientific communicators (Association des communicateurs scientifiques du Québec—ACS) is the largest science communication organization in Québec. Its members work in journalism and museums as well as in Québec universities, the media, schools, and anywhere scientific information is disseminated.

For the past 37 years, the ACS has defended the right to high-quality scientific information in Québec. It also awards the Fernand-Seguin bursary and the Hubert-Reeves prize.

In 2012, the ACS won the Press Freedom Prize, awarded by the Canadian Committee for World Press Freedom, as well as a prize from the Canadian Commission for UNESCO, for alerting the public and the international scientific community to the muzzling of Canadian scientists. http://bit.ly/1FsuUom)

This campaign is being organized by 15 volunteers, scientific communicators and science journalists from all sectors: magazines, TV programs, museums, science adaptation companies, and universities. 

Risques et défis

L'ACS s'est engagée financièrement dans cette campagne d'affichage, avec des moyens plus que limités en ayant confiance que les Québécois seront derrière elle.

Risks and challenges

Even with its extremely limited funding, the ACS has made a financial commitment to this billboard campaign, confident that Québecers will support it. 

D'autres façons d'aider

Tout coup de main est le bienvenu! Passez le mot à votre entourage et partagez la page IndieGogo et le mot-clic #ripostescientifique.

Si vous êtes journaliste scientifique, éducateur, vulgarisateur, communicateur scientifique, agent de communication, la meilleure façon de nous soutenir est d'être membre de l'ACS.

http://www.acs.qc.ca/membre.html

Other ways to help

Any assistance is welcome. Spread the word to family and friends, and share the IndieGogo page and the hashtag #ripostescientifique.

If you are a science journalist, educator, writer, communicator, or communications agent, the best way to help us is by becoming a member of the ACS.

http://www.acs.qc.ca/membre.html

Merci à nos partenaires!

  • Le Centre des sciences de Montréal
  • Québec Science
  • Les Débrouillards et Curium

Thank you to our partners

  • The Montréal Science Centre
  • Québec Science
  • Les Débrouillards and Curium
story_txt:
Pourquoi donner?

Des pancartes reniant l’influence des humains dans le rôle des changements climatiques ont fait leur apparition sur l'autoroute 40 dans la région de Montréal. Cette imposture scientifique est une nouvelle attaque envers l’intelligence des Québécois, et envers la culture scientifique que nous bâtissons depuis plusieurs décennies. Elle est d’autant plus vicieuse que ses auteurs, Friends of science, un organisme climatosceptique albertain, prétendent parler au nom de la science et usurpent sa crédibilité pour désinformer la population.


Why donate?

Billboards denying the influence of humans on climate change
have begun to appear along Autoroute 40 around Montreal. This scientific
misinformation is yet another attack on Québecers’ intelligence and on the scientific literacy we have been
building for many years. Even more perverse is that Friends of Science – the Alberta-based climate skeptic group
behind the billboards – claims to speak on behalf of science and is using the credibility
of science to mislead the public. 




Photo : Daniel-Jean Primeau 
Il faut réagir pour empêcher ces messages dangereux de s'implanter, des
messages qui minent les efforts que nous faisons pour contrer les changements climatiques. Et nous souhaitons affirmer, par tous les moyens possibles, que la désinformation scientifique n'est pas la bienvenue en sol québécois.
Avec votre appui, nous répliquons à cette campagne de désinformation scientifique en installant 3 panneaux sur les autoroutes 40 et 440, dans la région montréalaise. Un partenaire nous offre le graphisme et nous avons obtenu un rabais de près de 70% pour la production de ces panneaux, ciblant chacun entre 50 000 et 80 000 personnes par jour. Une occasion inespérée d'agir!
Cette riposte nous donnera l'occasion d'attirer l'attention du public sur la nécessité de préserver notre culture scientifique et de l'éduquer sur les mythes existants.
Aidez-nous en participant au financement de cette riposte pour rétablir les faits sur les changements climatiques et plus généralement pour garantir le droit à une information scientifique juste et de qualité!
-----

We must take action to prevent such dangerous messages from
taking hold – messages that undermine our efforts to counteract climate change.
We also want to state loudly and clearly, by every means possible, that
scientific disinformation is not welcome in Québec. 
With your support, we can respond to this campaign by installing
three billboards along Autoroutes 40 and 440 in the Montreal region. A partner
is providing the graphic design free of charge, and we are getting a 70%
discount on producing the billboards, each of which will reach 50,000 to 80,000
people per day. It’s
a golden opportunity to act!
This response will also be an opportunity to draw public
attention to the need to preserve scientific literacy and to debunk existing
myths. 
You can help to re-establish the facts about climate change and,
more broadly, to guarantee the right to accurate, high-quality scientific
information, by funding this campaign. 



Message des panneaux

Les panneaux interpellent les panneaux de Friends of Science.


[billboard text: What science really says: The climate is changing. Because of us.]


Notre message s’appuie notamment sur les conclusions du cinquième rapport sur les changements climatiques du Groupe d’experts intergouvernemental sur l’évolution du climat (GIEC) précisant que « il est extrêmement probable que l'humain est la cause dominante du réchauffement climatique depuis la seconde moitié du 20ème siècle. »
Ce message a été validé par plusieurs scientifiques, journalistes, vulgarisateurs et muséologues scientifiques. 
Billboard message
The billboards will be reminiscent of the Friends of Science message.
Our message is based on the conclusions of the fifth assessment report on climate change by the Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change (IPCC), which states that humans are “extremely likely to have been the dominant cause of the observed warming since the mid-20th century.”
This message has been validated by many scientists, journalists, science writers, and science museum curators. 


Comment sera employé votre argent?
L'argent recueilli servira :

aux frais de production et d’affichage des panneaux;
à la location d’espace sur les autoroutes 440 et 40;
à la promotion de la campagne;
à la coordination de la campagne auprès des médias et des partenaires.

Au-delà de 10 000$ (cet objectif est maintenant atteint!), l’argent servira donc à poursuivre la mission d'ACS qui consiste notamment à:


dénoncer d'autres actions de désinformation scientifique ou de manipulation de l'information scientifique;


soutenir les communicateurs scientifiques québécois;
organiser des actions et mettre en place des outils visant à former les communicateurs scientifiques et le public pour répliquer aux faux arguments scientifiques et mieux déchiffrer l’actualité scientifique.

Une première page d'information sur les répliques aux arguments des climatosceptiques vient d'être mise en ligne: http://www.acs.qc.ca/actualite/168-comprendre-l... et nous traduisons nos documents en anglais.


How will your donation be used? 

The
funds we collect will go toward:



billboard production and display costs,



leasing of billboard space along Autoroutes 440 and 40,

campaign promotion,


campaign coordination with media and partners.



Beyond $10,000, the funds will go toward
continuing the mission of the ACS, which includes:


denouncing other instances of scientific misinformation or of
manipulation of scientific data, 


support Quebec's science communicators,
organizing actions and developing tools to teach scientific
communicators and the public how to respond to false scientific arguments and
better interpret science news. 





Qui sommes-nous?
L’Association des communicateurs scientifiques du Québec (ACS) est le plus important regroupement de professionnels de la communication scientifique au Québec. Ses membres exercent dans le milieu journalistique et muséal ainsi que dans le réseau des universités québécoises, les médias, les écoles et les lieux de diffusion scientifique.
Depuis 37 ans, l’ACS défend le droit à une information scientifique de qualité au Québec. Elle organise notamment la bourse Fernand-Seguin et le prix Hubert-Reeves.
En 2012, l’ACS a reçu le Prix de la liberté de presse par le Comité canadien pour la liberté de presse et une bourse décernée par la Commission canadienne de l’UNESCO pour avoir alerté le public et la communauté scientifique internationale sur le musèlement des scientifiques canadiens. (http://bit.ly/1FsuUom)

Cette campagne est organisée par une quinzaine de bénévoles, communicateurs et journalistes scientifiques, issus de tous les milieux : magazines, émissions de télé, musées, entreprises de vulgarisation, universités. 

Who are we?
The Québec association of scientific communicators (Association des communicateurs scientifiques
du Québec—ACS) is the largest science communication organization in Québec.
Its members work in journalism and museums as well as in Québec universities, the
media, schools, and anywhere scientific information is disseminated. 
For the past 37 years, the ACS has defended the right to
high-quality scientific information in Québec. It also awards the Fernand-Seguin
bursary and the Hubert-Reeves prize. 
In 2012, the ACS won the Press Freedom Prize, awarded
by the Canadian Committee for World Press Freedom, as well as a prize from the
Canadian Commission for UNESCO, for alerting the public and the international
scientific community to the muzzling of Canadian scientists. http://bit.ly/1FsuUom)


This campaign is being organized by 15 volunteers, scientific
communicators and science journalists from all sectors: magazines, TV programs,
museums, science adaptation companies, and universities. 

Risques et défis
L'ACS s'est engagée financièrement dans cette campagne d'affichage, avec des moyens plus que limités en ayant confiance que les Québécois seront derrière elle.
 
Risks and challenges


Even with its extremely limited funding, the ACS has made a
financial commitment to this billboard campaign, confident that Québecers will support it. 

D'autres façons d'aider
Tout coup de main est le bienvenu! Passez le mot à votre entourage et partagez la page IndieGogo et le mot-clic #ripostescientifique.
Si vous êtes journaliste scientifique, éducateur, vulgarisateur, communicateur scientifique, agent de communication, la meilleure façon de nous soutenir est d'être membre de l'ACS.
http://www.acs.qc.ca/membre.html

Other ways to help
Any assistance is welcome. Spread the word to family and
friends, and share the IndieGogo page and the hashtag #ripostescientifique.
If you are a science journalist, educator, writer, communicator,
or communications agent, the best way to help us is by becoming a member of the
ACS. 


http://www.acs.qc.ca/membre.html

Merci à nos partenaires!

story:
Shortcut URL: http://igg.me/at/Support-Sterling-Geneva

 

THANKS FOR YOU SUPPORT -- To document this validation event, speak at press conference, secure an agreement to make the design available through an open license; while also keeping PES Network expenses covered, and to further our network.



FULL DESCRIPTION:

Could it really be true that there is such a thing as an all-magnet motor that can provide rotational torque for useful energy generation, with no apparent input other than what nature provides through principles of magnetism not yet fully understood? Modern science emphatically says "NO", but many inventors over the years have claimed to have defied that prediction, by building working motors.

Now, at the 41st International Exhibition of Inventions in Geneva from April 10-14, 2013, the world may have a chance to see such a motor.

The Turkish patent office has invited inventor Muammer Yildiz, to whom they awarded such a patent, to display his all-magnet motor at that expo; and he has invited me to participate in that event. The Turkish patent office is paying for Mr. Yildiz' trip.

As many of you who follow our Free Energy News know, I've been closely tracking the Yildiz all-magnet motor for the past few months, both in keeping a blog about it at PESWiki updated, as well as in helping to facilitate things through my interactions with the various players, including the inventor; his assistant, Halil Turkmen; the documentary film maker, Rene van der Woude of http://www.mixr.nl; Dr. Jorge Duarte of Eindhoven University, who has been vouching for this technology; and a guy, who for now prefers to remain anonymous, from another university who is helping to coordinate the scientific validation; among others involved in coordinating this.

We all, especially the inventor, are anxious to finally see this technology class vindicated once and for all, to never be doubted again.

This would be the beginning of a new scientific and energy revolution -- a paradigm crasher, an eye opener, and the opening of a new path forward in providing clean solutions to the world's energy problems.

With all the interactions I have had on this, many of them confidential, I am very certain about the reality of Mr. Yildiz's motor design being real.

And I'm crossing my fingers that the technology will be able to get at least a minimal level of validation at the Geneva expo.

Most of the people I mentioned above have been probing around on this, and have a significant list of reasons why they are confident that the technology works.

What we can do, versus what will actually be displayed, has been the topic of much discussion behind the scenes, taking a wide range of variables into consideration, including politics of science, noise levels in the expo hall, safety issues, electronic magnetic memory erasing issues, feasibility of a scientifically credible environment for validation, possible alternate locations for moving the unit from the hall to a secondary location, feasibility of moving the set-up.

One of the limiting factors is that though the motors work, they have been built on a low budget and don't always have the best possible components, such as the bearings needed to withstand the forces generated. Though well advanced from the duct tape and bailing wire stage of prototyping, they are not ready for full-on stress testing.

While he is on this trip, following the Geneva expo, Mr. Yildiz wants to take the motor(s) to a university for proper scientific testing, and he doesn't want to jeopardize their operation by trying to show off too much at the expo. Nor does he want to risk the chance of a malfunction during a public display. So he is playing it very cautious.

 

What such a demonstration needs to prove is that for the size of the motor, there isn't anything in today's known scientific literature that could be concealed inside the motor that could possibly keep it running for as long as it is shown to be able to run.

The skeptics have been assuming that Mr. Yildiz has some kind of energy storage inside the motor cavity, by which he can show the shaft turning, but that he has not shown it running for long enough to rule out a hidden energy storage mechanism.


A likely iteration will be the fan blade that Yildiz usually uses to demonstrate the technology. That motor body will be 14 cm in diameter and about 21 cm long, and the fan is 25 cm in diameter.


Yildiz says that the longest he has ever run a motor without stopping was fifteen days, with witnesses. But he needs witnesses willing to go on record, with credentials.

In Geneva, in addition to the university personnel who plan to come, we can also have others sign in and sign out, with their signature and credentials, to add to the list of witnesses of the technology running continuously. And by having a tag-team type of pass-off by always having someone else take over where they left off, a net duration can be established, with many overlapping witnesses throughout.

Open Source?

Also, while in Geneva, I am looking forward to meeting in person with Mr. Yildiz to talk through the possibility of having an open license for people to be able to pursue lower power versions of the design without an up-front license, with the stipulation that they remit a royalty on all commercial roll-outs. He has been very favorable so far in these discussions.

 

BUDGET:

The reason for this present fundrasier is to cover ongoing expenses of PES Network. We appreciate your continued support.

Some of the things excess funds could go to include:

  • Help with demo expenses in Geneva
  • Help with open license launch expenses
  • Donate to help Yildiz file for PCT patent coverage (not his idea; he does not like receiving funds, but is stubbornly independent, not wanting to give wrong impression about his motives)
  • Maintenance of PES Network
  • Expanding PES Network
  • Ability to assist other inventors

 

PROJECT MILESTONES:

- Arrive in Geneva
- Help set up demo, with a possible secondary location
- Help collect witness signatures
- Help interface between universities and Yildiz to meet validation requirements
- Surpass the minimum duration to rule out hidden storage capacity
- Surpass that by many times
- Establish terms for open license
- Demo much higher output capability for short durations
- Post plans for open license of lower output versions (e.g. < 5 kW)
- Press conference announcing success and ramifications

 

RISKS AND CHALLENGES:


- Mr. Yildiz could be stopped in his transport across international borders, despite having documentation from the Turkish patent office stating the purpose for the round trip.
- The motor(s) could be damaged during transport to the event.
- Mr. Yildiz could encounter problems assembling the system.
- The Expo venue may have rules (noise, safety) that disallow continuous operation of the motor.
- Webcams could malfunction, interrupting continuous observation by Internet audience.
- Mr. Yildiz may opt out of a secondary location because he wants to be present.
- Mr. Yildiz could opt to not demo the technology for a sufficient period of time.
- Mr. Yildiz could cancel the demo and only display the hardware.



FREQUENTLY ASKED QUESTIONS:

Q. Where can we watch the streamed version of the demo?
A. http://smartscarecrow.com/live/ - Will be broadcasting my feed continuously.

Q. How much does it cost to attend the Expo?
A. Media gets in free. The admittance fee for the general public is CHF 14/day with no previous registration.

 

SEE ALSO

YILDIZ MAGNET MOTOR FOOTER

  • Directory:Muammer Yildiz Magnet Motor
  • Event:2013:Yildiz_Magnet_Motor_Demos
    • January | February
    • Classifieds:2013:Yildiz_Magnet_Motor_Demo_Needs

MAGNET MOTORS FOOTER

  • Directory:Magnet Motors
  • News:Magnet Motors
  • PowerPedia:Magnetic motor – encyclopedic entry
  • Directory:Linear Magnet Accelerators
  • Directory:Magnetism
  • Directory:Magnets

story:
Here is what we need:

Our staff van has gone belly-up and has become a major money pit! It is clear that we need a new van, which is safe, reliable, cost effective and efficient.  The staff van is a support vehicle to the fabulous Fishmobile.  We need the van to transport our staff because all the seats in the Fishmobile are actually aquariums. 

Here is why we need it:

The Fishmobile bus is a traveling marine science program featuring live Chesapeake Bay animals, from toadfish to turtles.  It provides fun and exciting hands-on experiences for kids and adults.  Our one-of-a-kind program helps people to understand the environmental effects that people have on the Chesapeake Bay and its marine life.

Our formal Fishmobile education program is designed for students in Pre-K to 3rd grade. The Fishmobile also travels to summer camps, community festivals and corporate events, and even private events such as birthday parties.

Here is who we are:

At Phillips Wharf Environmental Center (PWEC) our mission is to inform, inspire, and involve people who live in the Chesapeake Bay region to become good stewards of America’s largest Bay. As children and adults encounter and interact with living Bay animals, they become aware of how the daily actions of each of the 17 million people in our area affect the Bay’s plants and animals.


    Other Ways You Can Help

    Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

    • Help us to get the word out and make some noise about the Follow the Fishmobile campaign!
    • Email and/or Facebook this campaign!

    And that's all there is to it.

story:
Please Help Send Scott to Cuba!

The acclaimed teacher of permaculture in the USA, Scott Pittman of the Permaculture Institute, is seeking funds to attend 11th International Permaculture Conference (IPC) in Cuba in November 2013.

Scott Pittman, the Permaculture Institute’s founder and recipient of the Permaculture Community Services Award, is one of the most renowned permaculture teachers in the United States. Permaculture Institute is raising funds to support Scott’s travel to the conference as a valuable contributor, presenter, and attendant.

For over 30 years, Scott has taught permaculture world-wide on four continents. He has worked at home in the Southwest, and also with Indigenous and traditional people around the world. An active contributor in the permaculture movement, Scott is known for his foundational work in developing Permaculture Diploma guidelines for the USA and as a co-founder of the Permaculture Credit Union.

About the Permaculture Institute:

The Permaculture Institute is a leader in permaculture education, preservation of its ethical standards, and in educational support. It sets national trends in critical areas of education and implementation that preserve the integrity of the movement as a whole in the face of continuing pressures to commercialize and trivialize permaculture.

About the conference:

In November 2013, permaculture teachers and practitioners from around the world converge in Cuba at the 11th IPC to share work and projects, report on trends in permaculture, the development of community initiatives, and the overall evolution of the movement. Participation in these gatherings by permaculture organizations, guilds, teachers, and visionaries is essential to invigorate their own work, inform their vision and to cross pollinate with ideas and proven solutions to world's sustainability challenges.

Why is it important that Scott is present at the 11thIPC?

Scott is a valuable contributor and presenter at permaculture conferences and gatherings. As one of the initial students of Bill Mollison (the founder of permaculture), Scott offers perspective on evolution of permaculture movement that traces its roots to the original vision. Scott is a leader in preserving ethical standards of permaculture, and the integrity of the permaculture curriculum. His expertise and wisdom are essential to share with each new generation of international permaculture practitioners and teachers. Scott is an active contributor to several large permaculture discussion forums in the US and his reports on 11thIPC events and happenings will be shared and posted on his personal blog and forums.

Thank you for your support! The funds raised here are used to purchase airfare, Cuban Visa, required health insurance, conference and convergence fees, accommodations during conference and convergence, transportation to scheduled events and tours, tour guide and translation. Any funds raised beyond our goal will be directed towards supporting attendance by the Costa Rican permaculture practitioners of Red Permanezca (Permaculture Network). Please donate to this campaign, spread the word, reach out to your community and friends as we continue to build momentum towards a more sustainable life for all.
story_txt:
Please Help Send
Scott to Cuba!

The acclaimed teacher of permaculture in the USA, Scott Pittman of
the Permaculture Institute, is seeking funds to attend 11th International
Permaculture Conference (IPC) in Cuba in November 2013.
Scott Pittman, the Permaculture Institute’s founder and recipient
of the Permaculture Community Services Award, is one of the most renowned
permaculture teachers in the United States. Permaculture Institute is raising
funds to support Scott’s travel to the conference as a valuable contributor,
presenter, and attendant. 
For over 30 years, Scott has taught permaculture world-wide on four
continents. He has worked at home in the Southwest, and also with Indigenous
and traditional people around the world. An active contributor in the
permaculture movement, Scott is known for his foundational work in developing
Permaculture Diploma guidelines for the USA and as a co-founder of the
Permaculture Credit Union. 
About the
Permaculture Institute:
The Permaculture Institute is a leader in permaculture education, preservation
of its ethical standards, and in educational support. It sets national trends
in critical areas of education and implementation that preserve the integrity
of the movement as a whole in the face of continuing pressures to commercialize
and trivialize permaculture. 
About the
conference: 
In November 2013, permaculture teachers and practitioners from
around the world converge in Cuba at the 11th IPC to share work and projects,
report on trends in permaculture, the development of community initiatives, and
the overall evolution of the movement. Participation in these gatherings by permaculture
organizations, guilds, teachers, and visionaries is essential to invigorate
their own work, inform their vision and to cross pollinate with ideas and
proven solutions to world's sustainability challenges. 
Why is it important
that Scott is present at the 11thIPC?
Scott is a valuable contributor and presenter at permaculture
conferences and gatherings. As one of the initial students of Bill Mollison (the
founder of permaculture), Scott offers perspective on evolution of permaculture
movement that traces its roots to the original vision. Scott is a leader in
preserving ethical standards of permaculture, and the integrity of the
permaculture curriculum. His expertise and wisdom are essential to share with
each new generation of international permaculture practitioners and teachers.
Scott is an active contributor to several large permaculture discussion forums
in the US and his reports on 11thIPC events and happenings will be shared and posted
on his personal blog and forums. 
Thank you for your
support! The funds raised here are used to purchase airfare, Cuban Visa,
required health insurance, conference and convergence fees, accommodations
during conference and convergence, transportation to scheduled events and
tours, tour guide and translation. Any funds raised beyond our goal will be
directed towards supporting attendance by the Costa Rican permaculture
practitioners of Red Permanezca (Permaculture Network). Please donate to this
campaign, spread the word, reach out to your community and friends as we
continue to build momentum towards a more sustainable life for all.

story:
Our Story

Allow us to introduce ourselves. We are a band of adventurers fundraising in order to participate in the charity Mongol Rally. Knowing each other since undergraduate studies, we are finally embarking on this epic journey. Dubbing ourselves "the Flying Dutchmen" and hopefully giving our car extra wings, our group consists of Matthias van de Raa, Nikolai Oudalov and Roeland van der Veen. An arduous race awaits us through some twenty countries traversing lakes, deserts, cities and mountain ranges until finally arriving in Ulan-Ude, Russia. While gas prices will decrease gradually, along with the cost of vodka until both are cheaper than clean water, we still need your help to get our little Suzuki all the way to Mongolia!

Who We Support

We will be donating a minimum of 500 GBP of the campaign to the Ocean Cleanup, a project that has the ambitious goal of becoming the largest cleanup in history. They are developing advanced technologies to rid the world’s oceans of plastic, an amazing mission!

Our second charity is Cool Earth and will receive at least 500 GBP as well. Cool Earth is the official charity of the Mongol Rally and is supported by every team taking part in the race. They work to save the worlds rainforests by purchasing land and then leaving it in a local trust which they support with education, employment, and volunteers to protect the rainforest!

What We Need

We are looking to raise $3000, with the first 1000 GBP going fully to our charities. If the donations exceed 1000 GBP, the rest will be evenly split between the two charities and ourselves, helping us making it safely to the other side of the world. This trip requires a massive amount of planning. We will be driving through harsh environments and fending off rogue traders on the Silk Route so there will be many things we will need for our trip. Anything from donations of equipment, tools, lodging, frequent flier miles, and anything else you cant think of would be greatly appreciated. The two easiest ways to help us is to donate directly to us here on our Indiegogo page (and potentially snag yourself a neat gift) or most importantly to GET THE WORD OUT!

Your donation here on our Indiegogo page will also help us cover a few of the initial fees and expenses involved in the Mongol Rally:

  • We need to pay a deposit to the company that runs the rally to ensure that the emergency response teams in Mongolia get something in the event our car isn't useable upon arrival in Mongolia
  • We need to buy our car and pay to register it and ensure it in every country we drive through.
  • We need visas to enter certain countries
  • We also need to pay for airfare back from the other side of the world, gas for our car, water and food, tons of supplies, and any unforeseen expenses

What You Get

As a donor you will get one of our many sweet perks located to the right (our gratitude, funky souvenirs, original photographs, your name on our car or daring, funny, embarrassing activities you can make us do on camera) delivered in time for Christmas 2017. Note that you can also just make a donation, of any value, by clicking the pink 'Back it' button. In any case, you will get the satisfaction of knowing you helped "the Flying Dutchmen" make their wildest dreams come true while also helping fellow human beings worldwide!

story:
My name is Chris, I work at Helen's Bay Organic Gardens, Northern Ireland and I love bees.  My partner Lara and I met through the farm and have the same love of nature, conservation and growing our own food. Lara is a full time mature student and poet.  We have four amazing children, two dogs and five hens.

A few years ago, after completing a degree in conservation, I started work as an assistant organic vegetable grower. Since then my passion for the environment has blossomed into a desire to produce locally grown organic food and to help foster the same passion in my children. 

Myself and lara intend to invest in five Rose hives and five colonies of Native Irish Honey bees to begin the apiary which will be sited at Helen's Bay Organic Gardens.   Having spent the past year researching we've decided that for us the Rose hive creates a more natural enviroment for the bees to thrive.  The Rose hive does not restrict the size of the honey bee colonies, they can increase in size which inturn creates a stronger colony that can better survive winters and negate the use of supplementary feeding with sugar water. Our ambition is create healthy organic sustainable food for our family and local community.

The money raised will help pay for hives, over wintered bee colonies and beekeeping equipment.


The honey will be available for purchase from the farm shop at Helen's Bay Organic Gardens, Azora Health Food shop in Hillsborough and Boxa Community Organic food group.  

Save the bees, save the world!


Update 13/4/2015:

We have set up a Facebook page to make it easier to share updates and iformation on bee conservation. (its a work in progress)

We plan to place the apiary at the bottom of the summer field where most of the salads, scallions, chard and broad beans etc.. are grown. It will be placed near an excisting apiary that is manage by Ben the bee man and he has very kindly offered to mentor our new beekeeping adventure. I was down today and snapped a little short video of his bees. Here it is:


I also took a few photos of the various flower plants that are out this time of year. Being an organic farm there is an amazing variety including some self seeded broad beans. See if you can spot of of Ben's native dark Irish honey bee (Apis mellifera mellifera).

Did you see the her?

Have a look on the Red dead nettle :)

The spot for the apiary is very over grown and I am working my way through all the brambles. Here is a the work so far, you can see the yellow flowers of the Black kale in the back round, the bees love this and it gives them a lot of early spring forage. Plus it makes beautiful sweet honey.




For anyone wishing to know more about the project please email me (Chris) at chris.maguire77@gmail.com.

All images are my own apart from the big bee one, that was found through a Google image search.

story:
Updated Letters of Interest

Although this is a "crowdfund" more importantly are "pledges" which are a $2 minimum to show your support for our cause to investors and other potential partners. Secondly, "letters of interest" are pertinent to land our project. Scroll to the bottom for details.
Here are our updated Letters of Interest:
- Hempknowlogy has been developing our blue print plans for our conference center. He wants to partner with us to develop 3D printed houses and sprayed hempcrete buildings.
-Ernest Hancock has expressed explicit interest in helping find and donate materials to build inhabitable domes on our property
-Josh Graveling, Yurt and Tiny house builder, has pledged to help build yurts and other glamping buildings onsite.
-We have one potential cosigner on our mortgage
-We have a landowner who wants to collaborate in community and business on her land. 
-Three people have expressed interest in owning shares in our business. 
- Solar Punk Festival & Global Ecovillage Network have expressed interest in hosting events onsite.

Short Summary

Many of you are visiting this crowdfund because you believe in us. You have followed Leonie’s and/or Chloe’s journey for many years. If that is the case, then you understand that we have reached a pivotal point in our life! We are ready to launch our ecovillage dream! We are so excited to share our plan with our family, friends, and peers. 

Who are we? 

  • Co-Founders of Whole Systems Network
  • Eco-Event Producers
  • Ecovillage Builders and Collaborators
  • Learn more about us here

(Scroll below to see more about our ecovillage project and strategy plan) 

Ecovillages are flourishing spaces for innovation in the dimensions of sustainability, economic, and social wellbeing. 

If you are unfamiliar with our journey below are a few reasons to consider supporting our project.

Ecovillages | A Positive Impact

Ecovillages have set a precedent for human and ecological development. We want to encourage this trend! 

  • At Dancing Rabbit each member on average uses 82% less electricity than an average US citizen per year. They also travel 90% less miles per year than the average US person. 

 

  • Despite Covid, many communities were able to have daily interactions if they quarantined collectively or had outdoor activities together 
  • An ecovillage in New Hampshire, La Cite Ecologique made over 8 Million Dollars in 2019 while sustaining over 68 jobs for locals. 

Our Timeline

*Disclaimer* Phases may change based on our current agreements with landowners and funds raised. Please join our calls for more information. 

    Our Targets Summarized

    (Learn more in our document with data and detailed targets here) 

    Our ecovillage will be monitored based on targets set and correlating data that we accumulate.

     

    Our Fundraising Ask

    Right now we are raising funds for Phase One. We are seeking donations, personal loans, and cosigned mortgages to secure our community land.

     We are planning to buy land in Burnsville, North Carolina, an hour away from Asheville. We are currently talking to a landowner who has a similar vision of ours and is inviting us to begin a community on her land.  We feel that securing funds for our land will exponentially open up possibilities for our future business and community collaboration.

    Our Infastructure

    Below are some images of our planned spaces (renders coming soon).

    Hempcrete Conference Center & Home Sites  -

    With natural materials & systems including hempcrete

    Design by Paul Carbone at Hempknowlogy

    And here is our ten year layout of the land:

    Design by Stephanie Phelan

     

      Other Ways For You to be Involved

      • Donate today!
      • Submit interest in becoming a cosigner of our property (note: this i for trusted friends and family)
      • Write a us an email or text describing your interest in:
        • hosting your event or wedding on our property
        • selling us a tiny houses / cabins / yurts for a discounted price

story:
The Tree Credits Method:

To pay rural communities to plant and care for trees (climate services), and thus tackle climate change and poverty as a single problem. 

The Tree Credits Foundation:

We are:

  • Promoters of a Global Transformation aimed at doubling the world’s green cover, restoring degraded lands, reforesting lost forests and ending poverty!

  • Facilitators of a monthly climate payment to all tree farmers registered on our Tree Registration Platform.

  • Partners in channelling available Climate Funds to the grass-roots.


Tree Credits India Project:

Stichting Tree Credits Foundation (Delft) will launch its India project in Trichy, Tamil Nadu in South India on the 1st of August 2015 in association with People’s Solidarity Association (PSA), Trichy. We will involve rural high school children and unemployed rural women in tree planting and tree caring activities, and monetarily reward them monthly for their climate services. The monthly payments will improve the economic condition of the participants and encourage them to plant more trees and in the bargain earn more money!

The highlights of the project are:

  • 1000 trees (fruit and medicine) will be planted and cared for, for 2 years in rural Trichy.

  • 100 participants (primarily students of age 15-18) will benefit from the project.

  • Participants will be paid by us monthly a fixed amount, based on regular proof of the health of the trees

This project will have tremendous impact on the local participants in improving their socio-economic conditions. A few major benefits are:

  • Increase in fixed monthly income.

  • Increase in income from alternative sources - fruits and medicines.

  • Improving soil and water quality - to boost in traditional farming output.

  • Increase local food production, both quantity and variety.

  • Inculcate a sense of ownership and responsibility towards the environment.

How can you help us?

Your contribution towards the project will give us the means to guarantee monthly payments for the climate services rendered by our participants in Trichy and in the bargain improve their living conditions and increase local food production.

We need €3500 to pay the participants continuously every month for 2 years.  A small portion of this amount will cover overheads like providing saplings, educational Materials, monitoring and administrative, and software costs.

Rewards to our contributors:

Animal Tree Puzzle


Wooden Climate Puzzle Toy

The Indefatigable Crusader

Elephant Family Puzzle


Noah's Ark

Families of the world Toys

World Animal Map Toy



If you don't have money to help, you still a have voice:

  • If you are low on funds, we understand. Just help repost and share the project. We know that you care about the environment and understand the importance of effort to fight climate change and poverty together. Let people know it’s time to change practices and fight climate change by rewarding for climate services.

  • Use the Indiegogo share tools to share on social networks.


A big green THANKS for helping us. Wish us luck and do what you can on your side of the lake to keep this planet clean!

story:
Short Summary

Wow, how exciting, I am set to graduate from UVIC with my BA in Coastal Geography and, what a way to finish. I will have completed my degree and now i've been given the most incredible opportunity to teach scuba diving and help develop a sustainable fisheries managment plan... In Mozambique Africa!! This is more than a dream.

I will be living at a small 9 room eco-lodge www.guludo.com. The concept of the lodge is fair trade, and with only a few foreign management staff the lodge employs close to 80 locals and contracts with over 150 local suppliers. The hotel has won two conde nast awards for poverty alleviation and education, and has been recognized for work with children and water.

I will be volunteering with the Nema foundation, owned by the same founders as Guludo, thier charity provides clean access to drinking water for over 20000 peoplev promotes health throught education and feeds 800 school children a day. I am ready for the adventure of a lifetime.... Now I just need a ticket! And it starts soon, APRIL soon, and this is too incredible to pass by. I really appreciate anything you can contribute to my journey!

Please Take a look at the two websites to learn more about Guludo or Nema. Both are great projects and worth your time to check out.

Nema -http://nemafoundation.tumblr.com/

 

                    Click the video too! 

               http://vimeo.com/61339044

The Cost

To fly round trip Vancouver to Mozambique is $3000, To get the visa I must have a round-trip ticket. After travel insurance and medical shots, it will probably be close to $4000. I am asking for $1500 to help fund my plane ticket. And truly anything you can contribute, even ~ good vibes ~ are humbly accepted with an open heart!

 Room and board at Guludo are paid for by the lodge but I must cover all expenses to get to Africa. I am going first as a volunteer with the posiblity of a small salary after a few months. Any help you can contribute I truly appreciate.

 

The Impact

Overfishing is a global concern, and an estimated 70% of global fisheries are in decline, exploited or being overfished, and in places like Mozambique one of the poorest countries in the world, fish is the primary protein source for coastal communities like Guludo. The question of sustainable fisheries is then of the most importance as it supports social, and economic livelihoods. Recent discovered of oil and gas in the region has contributed to the countries 10 year impressive growth rate however more business means more people and this has resulted in an increased demand on local fish stocks. I am thrilled to have the opportunity to work WITH communities and help develop conservation goals for fisheries preservation for future generation. 

Guludo lodge is described by the owner as "barefoot eco-chic"

There is no electricity, no running water and its a few hours from the closest town. This is an absolute adventure and I am so ready to take on the challenge.

I will be scuba diving and helping to expand a humpback whale program from July - November and I’ve read that Mozambique has some very amazing coral. This is the perfect way for my to combine my PADI instructor training and now my almost!!! finished undergraduate degree <3

Thank you for all your support!

 

Share with you friends

Help me get the word out! Help by Sharing with you friends!

Add a comment. :) like and share

Visit the www.Guludo.com Website or visit their Facebook page Guludo Beach Lodge and help spread the word about some amazing work being done in Mozambique.

This is more than a dream.
I will be living at a small 9 room eco-lodge www.guludo.com. The concept of the lodge is fair trade, and with only a few foreign management staff the lodge employs close to 80 locals and contracts with over 150 local suppliers. The hotel has won two conde nast awards for poverty alleviation and education, and has been recognized for work with children and water.
I will be volunteering with the Nema foundation, owned by the same founders as Guludo, thier charity provides clean access to drinking water for over 20000 peoplev promotes health throught education and feeds 800 school children a day. I am ready for the adventure of a lifetime.... Now I just need a ticket! And it starts soon, APRIL soon, and this is too incredible to pass by. I really appreciate anything you can contribute to my journey!
Please Take a look at the two websites to learn more about Guludo or Nema. Both are great projects and worth your time to check out.
Nema -http://nemafoundation.tumblr.com/
 
                    Click the video too! 
               http://vimeo.com/61339044
The Cost
To fly round trip Vancouver to Mozambique is $3000, To get the visa I must have a round-trip ticket. After travel insurance and medical shots, it will probably be close to $4000. I am asking for $1500 to help fund my plane ticket. And truly anything you can contribute, even ~ good vibes ~ are humbly accepted with an open heart!
 Room and board at Guludo are paid for by the lodge but I must cover all expenses to get to Africa. I am going first as a volunteer with the posiblity of a small salary after a few months. Any help you can contribute I truly appreciate.
 
The Impact
Overfishing is a global concern, and an estimated 70% of global fisheries are in decline, exploited or being overfished, and in places like Mozambique one of the poorest countries in the world, fish is the primary protein source for coastal communities like Guludo. The question of sustainable fisheries is then of the most importance as it supports social, and economic livelihoods. Recent discovered of oil and gas in the region has contributed to the countries 10 year impressive growth rate however more business means more people and this has resulted in an increased demand on local fish stocks. I am thrilled to have the opportunity to work WITH communities and help develop conservation goals for fisheries preservation for future generation. 
Guludo lodge is described by the owner as "barefoot eco-chic"
There is no electricity, no running water and its a few hours from the closest town. This is an absolute adventure and I am so ready to take on the challenge.
I will be scuba diving and helping to expand a humpback whale program from July - November and I’ve read that Mozambique has some very amazing coral. This is the perfect way for my to combine my PADI instructor training and now my almost!!! finished undergraduate degree <3
Thank you for all your support!
 
Share with you friends
Help me get the word out! Help by Sharing with you friends!
Add a comment. :) like and share
Visit the www.Guludo.com Website or visit their Facebook page Guludo Beach Lodge and help spread the word about some amazing work being done in Mozambique.
